column19:
S.C. (2014). Front. Plant Sci. 5:16. doi: 10.3389/fpls.2014.00016

The Journal and Authors retract the 4 February 2014 article cited above for the following reasons provided by the Authors:

After publication of this article
column20: we became aware that the transgenic plants described in this manuscript were not correct because of inadvertent errors in genotyping of the parent plants
column21: and thus the results presented in Figures 4
column22: 6 are not valid. We realized from the immunoblot result presented in Figure 4B
column23: that immunoprecipitated BAK1-ΔCT-Flag had the same apparent molecular weight as did BAK1-Flag
column24: despite the fact that truncated protein should have been ~4-kDa smaller but that size difference was not apparent. We subsequently confirmed that the BAK1 construct used was not truncated but was full length. At the moment we cannot explain why the transgenic plants show reduced growth
column25: but it is clear that it is not related to the BAK1 transgene. However
column27: 5 with recombinant proteins <italic>in vitro</italic> are valid
column28: and thus conclusions drawn from functional and interaction studies <italic>in vitro</italic> are correct. Regrettably
column29: the relevance to the function of BAK1 <italic>in vivo</italic> remains uncertain and it is no longer clear whether the carboxy-terminus of BAK1 is “required for normal growth of Arabidopsis” as stated in the title. The responsibility for this experimental error rests with only two of the authors: the senior author (MHO) who was a Senior Research Scientist when these studies were conducted with extensive experience in molecular biology and whose primary responsibility was production of the transgenic plants. The other responsible individual was the corresponding author (SCH)
column30: who failed to provide adequate oversight to the production of the transgenic plants and as a result
column31: critical checks and balances were not in place. The other authors (WX
column34:
and SDC) are not responsible in any way for this regrettable situation. We are pursuing follow-up experiments to correctly generate the BAK1-ΔCT-Flag transgenic plants in the bak1 bkk1 double null background that are required to test the functional role in vivo and hope to publish soon.

We sincerely regret any scientific misconceptions that have been caused by the above paper; the corresponding author's laboratory wasted an additional year studying these plants before the error was discovered. We apologize to the entire scientific community for the misinformation and any adverse consequences that may have resulted.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

The author was alerted that an American Type Culture Collection (ATCC) strain sequence for Mycoplasma meleagridis had recently been released. Phylogenetic analyses of the 16S rRNA gene and intergenic spacer region (IGSR) of all avian Mycoplasma spp.
column15: including the ATCC <italic>Mycoplasma meleagridis</italic> strain and strain B2096 8B

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.The effect of HER-2 polymorphism according to age on the risk and pathologic feature of endometrial cancer

Lee JM
column10:
Huh CY. The effect of HER-2 polymorphism according to age on the risk and pathologic feature of endometrial cancer. Korean J Obstet Gynecol 2009;52:529-537.

The above article from Korean J Obstet Gynecol
column12: has been retracted by agreement between the authors
column15:
and publication office of Korean J Obstet Gynecol.

The authors' statement follows below

In 2009
column16: we published two articles associated with the effect of HER-2 polymorphism on endometrial cancer. One article appeared in Korean J Obstet Gynecol and the other appeared in BJOG [<xref rid=""B1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]. Specifically
column17: the opening to the readers (including the opening in the online publication) of the two articles are similar. Although the article published in BJOG was designed
column20: we did not cite the article from BJOG because it had not yet been printed at that time. Thus
column21: in order to make clearance for referencing issue between Korean J Obstet Gynecol and BJOG
column22:
we decided to retract the paper published in Korean J Obstet Gynecol. We regret the inadvertent omission of the appropriate referencing and offer sincere apologies to readers for any inconvenience caused by this retraction.

TongSYHaSYKiKDLeeJMLeeSKLeeKBThe effects of obesity and HER-2 polymorphisms as risk factors for endometrial cancer in Korean womenBJOG20091161046105219438491" """article-type=.retraction"""

It was recently brought to our attention that a paper published in 2015 by Bin Wei
column7:
Zhong X. Upregulation of nucleostemin in colorectal cancer and its effects on cell malignancy. OncoTargets and Therapy. 2015;8:1805–1814.

Plagiarized significant portions of the text and several figures published in 2014:

Seyed-Gogani N
column10:
et al. Nucleostemin Depletion Induces Post-G1 Arrest Apoptosis in Chronic Myelogenous Leukemia K562 Cells. Advanced Pharmaceutical Bulletin. 2014;4(1):55–60.

The editor and publishers take the view that this is completely unacceptable. This paper is retracted.

This article has been retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief of OncoTargets and Therapy. A case of image duplication in Figure 5 was brought to the attention of the Editorial team. Due to the extent of the discrepancies
column7: the scientific validity of the data and hence the conclusions
column8:
are questionable. We apologise to the readers of the journal for not detecting it at submission/reviewing stage and any inconvenience caused.

Xu C
column9:
Li W. FAM172A expression in circulating tumor cells for prediction of high-risk subgroups of colorectal cancer. OncoTargets and Therapy. 2017;10:1933–1939.

The authors of this paper have advised Dove Medical Press that a collaborating laboratory had originally generated the key technology and data that was used in the published study. The authors did not have approval to use the data which has violated the rights of the collaborating lab. The authors are also in breach of the Dove Medical Press Terms of Publication. The authors seek to Retract the published paper.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column6: et al. column6:
et al. ALK-positive anaplastic large cell lymphoma with soft tissue involvement in a young woman. OncoTargets Ther. 2016;9:3993–3996.

A case of image duplication in Figure 2 was brought to the attention of the Editor in Chief. We were advised by the authors they were unable to provide us with the critical images. As a result
column7: we have been unable to assuage our serious concerns
column8:

Huang W
column7:
Song W. SUN1 silencing inhibits cell growth through G0/G1 phase arrest in lung adenocarcinoma. OncoTargets and Therapy. 2017;10: 2825–2833.

This article has been retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief of OncoTargets and Therapy. It was brought to the attention of the Editorial team by the authors that in Lentivirus package and transfection part of the Materials and Methods section
column8:
the authors noted “a nontargeting shRNA (5′-GCGGAGGGTTTGAAAGAATATCTCGAGATATTCTTTCAAACCCTCCGCTTTTTT-3′) was used as control”. Recently the authors were advised by the supplier of the lentivirus there was an error in the illustration concerning the control group sequence. The correct sequence should be TTCTCCGAACGTGTCACGTCTCGAGACGTGACACGTTCGGAGAATTTTT rather than GCGGAGGGTTTGAAAGAATATCTCGAGATATTCTTTCAAACCCTCCGCTTTTTT. The authors cannot confirm that the sequence carried by the control group lentivirus was TTCTCCGAACGTGTCACGTCTCGAGACGTGACACGTTCGGAGAATTTTT so they have decided to respectfully retract this original research paper and perform the experiments again to retest the data.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

Oncol Lett 9: 739-744
column5:
2015; DOI: 10.3892/ol.2014.2779

We wish to retract our research article entitled ‘3-Bromopyruvate inhibits human gastric cancer tumor growth in nude mice via the inhibition of glycolysis’ published in Oncology Letters 9 739–744
column6: 2015. Following the publication of this article
column7: an interested reader drew to our attention that two Figures (Figs. 1 and 2) and one Table (Table II) featured in the above-named article had also appeared
column8: either in their entirety or in part
column9: in our previous publication in Asian Pacific Journal of Cancer Prevention: Xian SL
column11: Zhang XD and Lu YF: Inhibitory effects of 3-bromopyruvate on human gastric cancer implant tumors in nude mice. Asian Pac J Cancer Prev 15 3175–3178
column12:
2014.

We had intended that the paper published in Asian Pacific Journal of Cancer Prevention focused on the observed phenomenon
column13: and the paper in Oncology Letters (a subsequent study) explored details of the mechanism. However
column14: we realize that our submission to Oncology Letters was in breach of the requirement that a submitted paper should represent ‘an original study presenting novel work
column15: that it has not been previously submitted to or accepted by any other journal’. The paper was submitted to Oncology Letters 2 months after the submission of the preceding paper to Asian Pacific Journal of Cancer Prevention
column16: where it was under consideration for publication at that time. Therefore
column17: we are going to retract the paper from Oncology Letters. All the named authors agree to this retraction. We sincerely apologize for this mistake
column18: and thank the reader of our article who drew this matter to our attention. Furthermore
column19:
we regret any inconvenience this mistake has caused.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

Oncol Lett 13: 1058-1062
column5:
2017; DOI: 10.3892/ol.2017.5585

Further to the publication of the above review article
column6: the Editor of Oncology Letters was contacted by an interested reader who drew to our attention that an extensive overlap existed between the text of the review and the doctoral dissertion
column7:
‘Induction of caspase-dependent death by proteasome targeted therapy in glioblastoma.’ 2015/05 http://digitalcommons.library.tmc.edu/utgsbs_dissertations/545/.

Following an investigation
column8: the journal is able to confirm that parts from the review are identical with those featured in the 2015 dissertation. On those grounds
column9:
we are retracting the review from the publication. The Editor deeply regrets any inconvenience that this retraction has caused to the readership of the Journal.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column3: provided the original work is properly cited
column4:
the use is non-commercial and no modifications or adaptations are made.

Oncol Rep 27: 1511-1519
column5:
2012; DOI: 10.3892/or.2012.1623

Following the publication of this article
column6: an interested reader drew to the attention of the Editorial Board that the above article appeared to contain a series of Figures that featured duplicated data. Following an internal investigation
column7: the Editorial Board reached the conclusion that the allegations of the reader were well-founded. Specifically
column8: the GAPDH bands shown in Figs. 2 and 3 are identical with those in Figs. 4C and 5D
column9: with the exception that the images have been reversed. Furthermore
column10: certain data in Fig. 4C of this paper appeared to have been shared with Fig. 3 in the following article (albeit for purportedly different experiments): Zhang J
column13: Chen W and Chen N: Inhibitory effects of ethyl pyruvate on invasion and metastasis of human gastric cancer SGC-7901 cells via downregulation of Akt pathway. China J Cancer Prev Treat (Chin) 39: 776–779
column15: we were unable to receive any response to our request for further information from the authors of this article. Given the extent of the anomalies with the data between the aforementioned papers
column16:
the Editorial Board has therefore decided to retract the article from Oncology Reports. We regret any inconvenience in this regard.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column12:
provided the original work is properly cited.

To our readers:

With deep regrets
column13: we inform our Readers that the article <related-object source-id=""http://dx.doi.org/10.4081/oncol.2014.236"" source-id-type=""url"" source-type=""book"" link-type=""retracted-article"" id=""ret1""><article-title>Challenges of combined everolimus/endocrine therapy in hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer</article-title></related-object> (DOI: <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://dx.doi.org/10.4081/oncol.2014.236"">http://dx.doi.org/10.4081/oncol.2014.236</ext-link>)
column14: which has been published Ahead of Print in the first issue of Oncology Reviews (2014)
column15:
contains verbatim text plagiarized from another paper.1

The manuscript must be considered as retracted.

On behalf of the Editorial Board of Oncology Reviews
column16:
I apologize to the Author of the manuscript whose text was plagiarized by Y. Abubakr and Y. Albushra that this was not picked up in the peer review process. I also apologize to the affected journal for the violation of copyright due to plagiarism.

Oncology Reviews is uncompromising in its commitment to scientific integrity. When credible evidence of misconduct is brought to our attention
column17:
our commitment to the scientific record and to our readership requires immediate notification.

Oncology Reviews is increasingly employing sophisticated software to detect plagiarism. Other journals use similar tools. Authors should be aware that most journals routinely employ plagiarism detection software
column18:
and that any plagiarism is likely to be detected.

Camillo Porta

column20: et al. Bedside Surgery to Treat Patent Ductus Arteriosus in Low-Birth-Weight Premature Infants. <italic>Open Journal of Cardiovascular Surgery</italic>. 2014;7:1–4. doi:10.4137/OJCS.S16156
column21:
on the basis of non-compliance with IRB requirements at their institution.

The editor in chief agrees with the need for this retraction. The publisher requires that all submissions to the journal obtain appropriate ethical approvals prior to submission. Confirmation was sought and subsequently obtained from the authors prior to publication
column24: that local ethical approval was not required on the basis that the study reported was retrospective. Following publication
column25: journal staff were informed by the authors on August 25
column27: that approval was in fact required by their institution
column28: and that it had not been obtained and could not be obtained retrospectively. In compliance with Committee on Publication Ethics guidelines
column29:
the article is therefore hereby retracted.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused to readers by the publication of this article.

Oxidative Medicine and Cellular Longevity has retracted the article titled “Nitroxyl (HNO): A Reduced Form of Nitric Oxide with Distinct Chemical
column9:
and Therapeutic Properties” [1]. The article was found to contain a substantial amount of material from the following published articles:

Nazareno Paolocci

column44:

Pan Afr Med JPan Afr Med JPAMJThe Pan African Medical Journal1937-8688The African Field Epidemiology Network245204253920672PAMJ-17-10310.11604/pamj.2014.17.103.3995ResearchRetraction: Association between the use of biomass fuels on respiratory health of workers in food catering enterprises in Nairobi Kenya. Pan Afr Med J. 2013 May 6;15:12. doi: 10.11604/pamj.2013.15.12.1831102201420141710309220140922014

The editors of the Pan African Medical Journal retract the manuscript above. The manuscript has been the subject of a protracted and unresolved authors dispute. Not all the authors listed in this manuscript consented to the retraction.

retractionRetraction: Association between the use of biomass fuels on respiratory health of workers in food catering enterprises in Nairobi Kenya. Pan Afr Med J. 2013 May 6.

Pan Afr Med JPan Afr Med JPAMJThe Pan African Medical Journal1937-8688The African Field Epidemiology Network245239493921981PAMJ-17-10410.11604/pamj.2014.17.104.4004ResearchRetraction: Plagiarism in ""Detection of ESBL among ampc producing enterobacteriaceae using inhibitor-based method"" (Pan Afr Med J. 2013;14:28)122201420141710410220141022014

We
column2: editors of The Pan African Medical Journal hereby notify readers of the retraction of the article ""Detection of ESBL among ampc producing enterobacteriaceae using inhibitor-based method"" by Bakthavatchalu S et al. [<xref rid=""CIT0001"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] published in 2013. It has come to the attention of the editorial team that this article shares striking similarities with the article “Comparison of the boronic acid disk potentiation test and cefepime-clavulanic acid method for the detection of ESBL among AmpC-producing Enterobacteriaceae.” by Shoorashetty RM et al.[<xref rid=""CIT0002"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]
column3: published in the Indian Journal of Medical Microbioly in 2011. An internal investigation has raised sufficient evidence of plagiarism; as such
column4:
we retract this article from the literature in accordance with guidelines and best editorial practices from the Committee on Publication Ethics. We apologize to our audience about this unfortunate situation.

retractionDetection of ESBL among ampc producing enterobacteriaceae using inhibitor-based method. 2013;

column4: and build upon the work non-commercially
column5:
as long as the author is credited and the new creations are licensed under the identical terms.Oleandrin: A cardiac glycosides with potent cytotoxicity

The Editor and Publisher of the journal Pharmacognosy Reviews regret to announce that the article entitled “Oleandrin: A cardiac glycosides with potent cytotoxicity” published in pages 131-139
column7: Volume 7 of the journal has been retracted on the grounds of plagiarism[<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]. After the article's publication
column8: it was brought to the journal's attention by a reader that several sections of the article have been directly copied and/or paraphrased without sufficient attribution including
column11: <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bufadienolide"">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bufadienolide</ext-link> and <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleandrin"">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Oleandrin</ext-link>. Pharmacognosy Reviews published this article in good faith
column12: and on the basis of signed statements made by the corresponding author regarding the originality of their work. The authors of the article have been contacted in accordance with COPE Guidelines
column13:
and did not respond.

Notes

The online version of the original article can be found under doi: 10.4103/0973-7847.120512.

REFERENCEKumarADeTMishraAMishraAKOleandrin: A cardiac glycosides with potent cytotoxicityPhcog Rev20137319" """article-type=.retraction"""

column6: “Solid hemangioblastoma in the cerebellopontine angle: Importance of external carotid blood supply with regard to the probable site of origin and preoperative embolization” published in pages S1-4
column8: vol. 7 of “Surgical Neurology International”[<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] is being retracted. Michał J. Ciebiera*
column8:
Grzegorz Jakiel

Laparoscopic isthmocele treatment – single center experience

Videosurgery Miniinv 2017; 12 (1): 88–95

DOI: https://doi.org/10.5114/wiitm.2017.66025

The main and corresponding author
column9: Dr Michał Ciebiera submitted this article to the “Videosurgery and Other Miniinvasive Techniques” Journal on 10 of July 2016 and it was published after positive reviews in: Videosurgery Miniinv 2017; 12 (1): 88–95
column10:
DOI: https://doi.org/10.5114/wiitm.2017.66025.

Dr Michał Ciebiera subsequently raised concerns related to the accuracy of the data presented in the article and asked for withdrawal of the article.

The editors of the “Videosurgery and Other Miniinvasive Techniques” Journal who act according to the COPE Code of Conduct
column11:
consider this an infringement of professional ethics and the decision has been made to retract the article published in the Videosurgery and Other Miniinvasive Techniques Journal.

The editors of “Videosurgery and Other Miniinvasive Techniques” Journal are sorry for any inconveniences coused to the reviewers
column12:
editorial staff and to the readers.

Jacek Szeliga“Videosurgery and Other Miniinvasive Techniques” Editor-in-Chief" """article-type=.retraction"""

column25:
Matsumoto H. Strategy for prevention of hip fractures in patients with Parkinson’s disease. World J Orthop 2012; 3(9):137-141 PMID: 23173109 DOI: 10.5312/wjo.v3. i9.137. The online version of the original article can be found at https://www.wjgnet.com/2218-5836/full/v3/i9/137.htm

This meta-analysis article[1] has been retracted at the request of the Co-Editors-in-Chief
column26: as a substantial portion of the primary studies on which the review was based [References 12
column28:
15] have subsequently been retracted.

The Editors-in-Chief recently received communications indicating that 3 of the 5 articles on which the study was based upon were retracted
column29: raising concerns about the integrity of the meta-analysis and its findings. The Editorial Office has conducted an investigation and has contacted the authors concerning the allegation. The authors declare that at the time the article was written
column30:
none-except for Dr. Yoshihiro Sato were aware of the fact that the studies subject to the analysis had been fraudulently conducted. The authors have agreed to retract the article from the Journal.

Manuscript source: Invited manuscript

Article in press: September 21

column4:
provided the original work is properly cited.Bilateral Popliteal Artery Aneurysms with Rupture and Pseudoaneurysm Formation on the Left

This article has been found to be a duplicate publication
column5: which has appeared in both <italic>EJVES Extra</italic><xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref> and <italic>Yonsei Medical Journal</italic>.<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref> This article is now retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief
column6: <italic>European Journal of Vascular and Endovascular Surgery</italic>
column7:
as this article first appeared in EJVES Extra (the electronic companion journal to European Journal of Vascular and Endovascular Surgery).

Reason: The article was originally published in the EJVES Extra in 2002
column9: under a same title. This is a violation of the <italic>Yonsei Medical Journal</italic> policy against duplicate publication
column10: clearly stated in the journal's ""Information for Contributors"". The corresponding author
column11: Dr. Canbaz knew that the article had been previously published in the EJVES Extra. In accordance with journal policy
column12:
Dr. Canbaz has been barred from publishing in Yonsei Medical Journal for three years.

The journal's policy in this respect is clear: the Yonsei Medical Journal considers all manuscripts on the strict condition that they have been submitted only to the Yonsei Medical Journal
column13: that they have not been published already
column14:
nor are they under consideration for publication or in press elsewhere.

column8:
provided the original work is properly cited.Cortical margining capabilities of fins associated with ventral cervical spine instrumentationTo the Editor

My original paper on the ""Cortical Margining Capabilities of Fins1"" has been made based on the data studied while I was working at the Cleveland Clinic Foundation as a research fellow. However
column9:
this article was submitted to two international journals by me and the co-author at the same time independently. I hereby retract the paper.

column18:
provided the original work is properly cited.Prognostic and Predictive Value of Carcinoembryonic Antigen and Cytokeratin-19 Fragments Levels in Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer Patients Treated with Gefitinib or Erlotinib

Dear Editor

We deeply regret to inform you that our paper was submitted twice to two different Journals
column19: and was already published in another Journal<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>; therefore
column20: we are requesting to retract our paper that has been published in YMJ.<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref> We mistakenly submitted our paper to the other journal. As the corresponding author
column21:
I will take full responsibility for this error and respectfully request for the retraction of our paper from YMJ.

JungMKimSHLeeYJHongSKangYAKimSKPrognostic and predictive value of CEA and CYFRA 21-1 levels in advanced non-small cell lung cancer patients treated with gefitinib or erlotinibExp Ther Med2011268569322977560JungMKimSHHongSKangYAKimSKChangJPrognostic and predictive value of carcinoembryonic antigen and cytokeratin-19 fragments levels in advanced non-small cell lung cancer patients treated with gefitinib or erlotinibYonsei Med J20125393193922869475" """article-type=.retraction"""

column8:
provided the original work is properly cited.Human Papillomavirus Type 16 E5 Protein as a Therapeutic Target

To the Editor

I deeply regret to inform you and request for retraction of our review paper published in YMJ.1

We have applied for the U.S. patent with some ideas and research data which are related to the review paper. Upon request from a patent lawyer's office
column9: we checked the references used in our paper for the Information Disclosure Statement (IDS). We realized that our review paper plagiarized several sentences from a previously published review paper titled as ""The biochemical and biological functions of human papillomavirus type 16 E5 protein"" in Arch Virol (2003;148:1445-53). As a corresponding author
column10:
I will take full responsibility and respectfully request for the retraction of our review paper from YMJ.

KimSWYangJSHuman papillomavirus type 16 E5 protein as a therapeutic targetYonsei Med J200647111416502480" """article-type=.retraction"""

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.Comparison of the Effect of Vitamin K2 and Risedronate on Trabecular Bone in Glucocorticoid-Treated Rats: A Bone Histomorphometry Study

We decided to retract the paper entitled ‘Comparison of the Effect of Vitamin K2 and Risedronate on Trabecular Bone in Glucocorticoid-Treated Rats: A Bone Histomorphometry Study’ [Yonsei Med J 2009;50(2):189-194] by Iwamoto J
column8: et al. Based on information that were discovered after publication
column9:
we have recently become aware of a number of issues related to data duplication and scientific misconduct.

Jung-Won Park

column13:
the metal atom was reported incorrectly.

The author of Zhao (2007) ▸ has indicated that the metal atom in the reported complex was assigned incorrectly. The paper is therefore withdrawn from the published literature.

This article [1] has been retracted by the authors. Although the patients originally gave consent to publication of their cases and images
column11:
they withdrew this consent shortly after publication. The article is no longer available online in order to protect patient confidentiality. The author apologizes for the inconvenience.

column33:
provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

The authors have retracted this article [1] due to the ethical misconduct of Karel Bezouska and misappropriation of data which fundamentally changes the main findings of the article. Specifically
column34: the upper amino acid sequence in Figure 1 (by KB) in BMC Biotechnol <bold>11</bold>:2 was incorrect
column35:
therefore Nit-ANigWT and Nit-ANigRec (nitrilase expressed in E. coli harbouring a nit gene from A. niger K10) were not variants of the same enzyme as hypothesized in the original article. The different biochemical properties of Nit-ANigWT and Nit-ANigRec discussed in the paper were caused by a significant difference in the primary structures of these enzymes.

The Publisher and Editor regretfully retract this article [1] because the peer-review process was inappropriately influenced and compromised. As a result
column16: the scientific integrity of the article cannot be guaranteed. A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column17:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1471-2407-14-28.

A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column13:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1471-230X-14-62.

provided the original work is properly cited.

Retraction article

Retraction

After publication of article [1]
column23: we became aware of the fact that Figures one C (let-7a and let-7a#)
column24: four B (bmo-let-7a and bmo-let-7a#) and five B (let-7a and let-7a#) were duplicated from another published article [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref>]. In light of these problems
column25: the authors in consultation with the journal's Editors
column26:
have decided to retract article [1] from BMC Genomics. The authors are currently preparing a new manuscript clarifying the role of let-7a during the life cycle of the silkworm.

This article has been retracted [1] by the authors because they do not have ownership of the data presented
column14: which was originally collected by the Laboratorio Management e Sanità of Scuola Superiore Sant’Anna. In addition

column16:
the publisher and the authors of the Italian publication for any inconvenience caused.

column18:
provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

The authors would like to retract the article ""The absence of MyD88 has no effect on the induction of alternatively activated macrophage during Fasciola hepatica infection"" published in BMC Immunology (2011
column19: <bold>12</bold>:63). The text and figures in this article [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>] have been misappropriated from a different set of experiments using a different parasite
column20: conducted in the laboratory of Prof J Allen and presented in the thesis of K Mylonas. Lead author Dr HongLin Luo accepts full responsibility for this and would like to apologise to colleagues in the lab
column22:
Editors and readers. The other authors take no responsibility for the misappropriation.

This article [1] has been retracted by the editors of BMC Musculoskeletal Disorders due to extensive overlap with previously published work [2]. We apologise for the inconvenience caused.

Meiying Wang and Hongsheng Sun contributed equally to this work.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1471-2474-10-141.

unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2015Retraction

The Publisher and Editor regretfully retract this article [1] because the peer-review process was inappropriately influenced and compromised. As a result
column21: the scientific integrity of the article cannot be guaranteed. A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column22:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

ReferenceWang W
column29: Wang P. Open reduction and closed reduction internal fixation in treatment of femoral neck fractures: a meta-analysis. BMC Musculoskeletal Disorders. 2014;15:167.</mixed-citation></ref></ref-list></back>"	"""article-type=.retraction"""

column36: provided the original work is properly credited. The Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication waiver (<ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/"">http://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/</ext-link>) applies to the data made available in this article
column37:
unless otherwise stated.Retraction

This article [1] has been retracted by the authors
column38: as some of the reported data was incorrect. The error concerned approximately 8% of the cohort (women who answered the first version of the food frequency questionnaire
column39:
before 2002) and was caused by misclassification of the amount of the women’s reported folic acid supplementation (no supplement use instead of missing information on supplement use). The error led to minor changes in the results.

However
column40:
the estimate of the association between folate intake and spontaneous preterm delivery did not change the conclusions after the error was corrected.

In consultation with the Journal’s editors we decided to retract the article from BMC Pregnancy and Childbirth.

A corrected manuscript will be resubmitted to the Journal at the time of retraction.

On behalf of all authors
column41:
Verena Sengpiel and Bo Jacobsson.

Pre-publication history

http://www.biomedcentral.com/1471-2393/14/202/prepub

column8:
provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

The authors have retracted this article [1] as the fMRI data presented in the case report are incorrect. The activation data reported for session 1 are the activation data for session 2 and vice versa. As a result the discussion and conclusions of the case report are based on the wrong set of data and are no longer valid. The authors apologise for the error.

This article [1] has been retracted by the authors due to significant overlap with a previous publication [2]. Giuseppe Rengo and Gennaro Pagano were not involved in the study and were introduced into the author list by the corresponding author. All authors
column22: including Giuseppe Rengo and Gennaro Pagano
column23:
have subsequently agree that they did not qualify for authorship. The remaining authors apologize for any inconvenience caused.

The online version of the original article can be found at 10.1186/1471-2482-13-S2-S25

unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2014Retraction

The Editors regretfully retract the article [1] as we believe the peer-review process was compromised and inappropriately influenced by the authors. Following further post-publication peer review the Editors no longer have confidence in the soundness of the findings. We apologise to all affected parties for the inconvenience caused.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1752-0509-6-20.

provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

This article [1] has been regretfully retracted due to plagiarism by the authors. The method for the identification of Borrelia burgdorferi sensu lato species in ticks presented in the article was originally developed and published by Sjoerd Rijpkema and colleagues [2]. The authors apologise to all affected parties for the inconvenience caused.

column3:
distribution and reproduction in any medium provided that the original work is properly attributed.

This Research Article has been retracted at the request of the corresponding author
column4:
John G. Pastorino.

This notice updates and replaces a recent Expression of Concern
column5:
published on 21 January 2016 (see Supplementary information).

Biology Open was alerted to potential blot duplication and reuse in this article. These concerns were relayed to Dr Pastorino
column7: who responded with an explanation and original data. Following review of these data
column8: we felt unable to resolve this matter at a distance
column9:
so contacted the authors’ institution (Rowan University) and requested that they investigate further.

Following their assessment
column10:
Rowan University required that Dr Pastorino retract this paper. Dr Pastorino also entered a Voluntary Exclusion Agreement with The Office of Research Integrity (ORI); the agreement can be found here: http://ori.hhs.gov/content/case-summary-pastorino-john-g.

ORI found that Dr Pastorino intentionally falsified and/or fabricated data
column13: or trimmed and/or manipulated blot images from unrelated sources to obscure their origin
column14:
and relabelled them to represent different experimental results in:

 • Figures 3A and 6B in Biol. Open 2015” (doi: 10.1242/bio.014712).

The PDF of the retracted article is available as Supplementary information.

Click here for additional data file.

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.

At the request of the authors
column6: the article titled “A Comparison between Three-Dimensional Visualization Guided Hepatectomy and Ultrasonography Guided Radiofrequency Ablation in the Treatment of Small Hepatocellular Carcinoma within the Milan Criteria” [<xref rid=""B1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] has been retracted. The article was found to contain substantial errors
column8:
which mean the data do not support the conclusions. The authors apologize for these errors.

(1) Nine patients were wrongly classified. Five patients in the surgery group with mixed hepatocellular carcinoma
column9: cholangiocarcinoma in the postoperative pathological analysis
column10:
were wrongly recorded as having hepatocellular carcinoma based on intraoperative frozen section examination. Four patients in the radiofrequency ablation group had severe dysplasia rather than hepatocellular carcinoma according to histopathology in the follow-up period.

When these patients are excluded
column11: liver function is a risk factor for survival (hazard ratio = 1.8
column13:
but this parameter was wrongly excluded from the risk factors in the published article.

(2) There was high multicollinearity between liver function of Child-Pugh Class and Tbil
column16: condition index = 20.484 > 10; <xref ref-type=""table"" rid=""tab1"">Table 1</xref>). Due to this
column17: the results may change unpredictably in response to small changes in the model or the data [<xref rid=""B2"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. To overcome this issue
column18:
we need a larger sample size and improved statistical methodologies [3].

This article entitled “Intracoronary Adenosine versus Intravenous Adenosine during Primary PCI for ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction: Which One Offers Better Outcomes in terms of Microvascular Obstruction?” [1]
column7: has been retracted upon the authors' request
column8: as it was found to include erroneous data that their findings and conclusions cannot be relied upon. Additionally
column9:
the article was submitted for publication by the author Gemina Doolub without the knowledge and approval of the other author Erica Dall'Armellina.

DoolubGDall'ArmellinaEIntracoronary adenosine versus intravenous adenosine during primary PCI for ST-elevation myocardial infarction: which one offers better outcomes in terms of microvascular obstruction?ISRN Cardiology201320138 pages248476" """article-type=.retraction"""

At the request of the authors
column9: the published article [<xref rid=""B1-ijerph-12-14114"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] will be retracted. The manuscript is a duplicate of another publication by the same authors [<xref rid=""B2-ijerph-12-14114"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. The paper was submitted to the other journal two months earlier than to the <italic>International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health</italic> (<italic>IJERPH</italic>) and was published online nearly one month after the submission to <italic>IJERPH</italic>. Our policy is to consider only original
column10: unpublished articles that are not under review by any other journal
column11: and all authors explicitly agree to this as a condition for processing their submissions. The authors have stated that the duplicate submission was caused by a lack of internal communication
column12:
for which they deeply apologize.

MDPI is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics and takes the responsibility to enforce strict ethical policies and standards very seriously. To ensure the addition of only high quality scientific works to the field of scholarly publication
column13:
paper [1] is retracted and shall be marked accordingly. We apologize to our readership for any inconvenience caused.

column16:

The two articles [1
column17: <xref rid=""B2-ijms-18-01483"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>] published in the <italic>International Journal of Molecular Sciences</italic> will be retracted. An investigation of the peer review process has concluded that it was compromised via the use of fake reviewer email addresses provided by the authors. MDPI takes the integrity of its review process very seriously. Since bringing the management of the peer review process in-house in 2006 [<xref rid=""B3-ijms-18-01483"" ref-type=""bibr"">3</xref>]
column18: we have had in place criteria for inviting peer reviewers which include confirmation of their identity
column19: especially for reviewers suggested by authors. In the years since the publication of [<xref rid=""B1-ijms-18-01483"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] and [<xref rid=""B2-ijms-18-01483"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]
column20:
we have further updated the technology available to editors in order to mitigate against the possibility that review reports could be faked by the authors.

An internal investigation has concluded that for these two papers the procedures were not correctly followed
column21:
for which we apologize to the readers of the journal. The investigation covered all MDPI journals and these were the only problematic cases discovered.

We believe that the vast majority of authors submit manuscripts in good will
column22:
however we remain vigilant for suspicious activity and strive to have robust procedures in place to ensure that such cases can be discovered prior to publication.

In article [1]
column12: several Western blot bands in Figures 1–4 have been questioned due to similarity. The authors’ usual protocol is to photograph the final Western blot bands save them as TIF files. Unfortunately
column13: the authors did not keep TIF files for all of the questioned bands. Thus
column14: by mutual agreement between the authors and the journal
column15: the article will be retracted. The authors apologize for any inconvenience caused
column16:
and intend to carry out the reported experiments again and submit it as a new article.

The article will be marked as retracted. The International Journal of Molecular Sciences is a member of COPE and takes research integrity
column17: including the correct reporting of figures
column18:
very seriously.

The paper titled “Detection of Abnormal Hemoglobin Variants by HPLC Method: Common Problems with Suggested Solutions
column6: ” [<xref rid=""B1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] published in International Scholarly Research Notices
column7: has been retracted as it was submitted for publication without the knowledge and approval of one of the coauthors
column8:
Dr. Suman Lata Mendiratta. The submitting author Dr. Dipti Kalita plagiarized data from the Thalassemia Control Project headed by Dr. Suman Lata Mendiratta.

PantL.KalitaD.SinghS.Detection of abnormal hemoglobin variants by HPLC method: common problems with suggested solutionsInternational Scholarly Research Notices201420141025780510.1155/2014/257805" """article-type=.retraction"""

International Scholarly Research Notices has retracted the article titled “Growth Responses and Leaf Antioxidant Metabolism of Grass Pea (Lathyrus sativus L.) Genotypes under Salinity Stress” [1]. The article was found to contain images with signs of duplication and manipulation in Figures 5(a)
column9: and duplication from Talukdar D. Plant Growth and Leaf Antioxidant Metabolism of Four Elite Grass Pea (<italic>Lathyrus sativus</italic>) Genotypes
column10:
Differing in Arsenic Tolerance. Agric Res (2013) 2: 330. doi:10.1007/s40003-013-0085-3 in Figure 6.

TalukdarD.Growth responses and leaf antioxidant metabolism of grass pea (Lathyrus sativus L.) genotypes under salinity stressISRN Agronomy201320131528483010.1155/2013/284830" """article-type=.retraction"""

At the request of the authors and the hospital
column6:
the article titled “The Impact of Graft Nephrectomy on Subsequent Transplants: Multivariate Analysis of Risk Factors for Second Graft Loss and for Multiple Transplantations–A Single-Center Retrospective Study” [1] has been retracted. The data reported in the article were not reviewed by the Renal Transplant Unit of the Royal London Hospital before submission. The data is not a complete capture and as a result is not an accurate reflection of the effect of the intervention.

GiorgakisE.SyedA.GonzalezH.The impact of graft nephrectomy on subsequent transplants: multivariate analysis of risk factors for second graft loss and for multiple transplantations–A Single-Center Retrospective StudyISRN Transplantation20132013936257110.5402/2013/362571" """article-type=.retraction"""

column16:
unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2015Retraction

The Publisher and Editor regretfully retract this article [1] because the peer-review process was inappropriately influenced and compromised. As a result
column17: the scientific integrity of the article cannot be guaranteed. A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column18:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/s13019-014-0194-5.

In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column26:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

Ruogu Li and Shuansuo Yang contributed equally to this work.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1749-8090-9-41.

ReferenceLiRYangSTangLYangYChenHGuanSMeta-analysis of the effect of percutaneous coronary intervention on chronic total coronary occlusionsJ Cardiothoracic Surgery201494110.1186/1749-8090-9-41" """article-type=.retraction"""

The following article from Journal of Cellular and Molecular Medicine (volume 10
column13: ‘Differential proteomic profiling to study the mechanism of cardiac pharmacological preconditioning by resveratrol’ by Karel Bezstarosti
column15: Jos. M. J. Lamers and Dipak K. Das
column16: and published in the October 2006 issue in Wiley Online Library (<ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com"">http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com</ext-link>)
column17: has been retracted by agreement between the authors
column19: Professor LM Popescu and Blackwell Publishing Ltd. The retraction has been agreed due to findings of data fabrication in the western blot data in Figure 6 that occurred in the laboratory of Dipak K. Das in an investigation into the work of Dipak K. Das by the University of Connecticut Health Center. Although no questions have been raised concerning the data generated by Karel Bezstarosti and Jos M J Lamers
column20:
these authors fully support the retraction.

This article [1] has been retracted by the Editor as it was published in error and has already been published elsewhere [2]. After the peer review process
column15: the authors uploaded the wrong manuscript in error. Due to an oversight
column16: the manuscript was subsequently accepted and published. The authors
column17:
Editor and BioMed Central apologise to all involved.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/s40201-014-0153-z.

column15:
provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

The authors would like to retract the article ""Screening and Identification of a Renal Carcinoma Specific Peptide from a Phage Display Peptide Library"" [1]. After the article was published it was revealed that the data in figure three
column16: reported to show the Immunohistochemical staining of renal carcinoma
column17: actually shows the results from an unrelated experiment on lung tissue due to incorrect labeling. The authors apologize to the readers
column19:
and editors for publishing this erroneous data.

The authors have retracted this article [1] as there was a large overlap with a previously published article in International Journal of Cancer [2]. Dr Lu ShihHsin
column14:
was not aware of the publication in Journal of Experimental & Clinical Cancer Research and the grant reference number stated in the acknowledgements was incorrectly applied to this article.

column18:
unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2018Retraction

The authors have retracted this article [1] because of significant overlap of text and some images with a previously published article by Xu et al. [2]. A formal investigation by the 1st Affiliated Hospital of Wenzhou Medical University has found that some panels in Fig. 6b [1] are identical with panels in Fig. 5a [2] and some images of mice lungs in Fig. 6c [1] are identical with images in Fig. 3g [2]. The data reported in this article are therefore unreliable. All authors agree to this retraction.

The online version of the original article can be found athttps://jhoonline.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13045-016-0288-8.

ReferencesFanYWangYSuHFangNZouCLiWFeiZDecreased expression of the long noncoding RNA LINC00261 indicate poor prognosis in gastric cancer and suppress gastric cancer metastasis by affecting the epithelial–mesenchymal transitionJ Hematol Oncol201695710.1186/s13045-016-0288-827439973XuTHuangMXiaRLiuXSunMYinLChenWHanLZhangEKongRDeWShuYDecreased expression of the long non-coding RNA FENDRR is associated with poor prognosis in gastric cancer and FENDRR regulates gastric cancer cell metastasis by affecting fibronectin1 expressionJ Hematol Oncol201476310.1186/s13045-014-0063-725167886" """article-type=.retraction"""

column16:
provided the original work is properly cited.Retraction

BioMed Central is publishing a retraction of this article [1] because the article was published in error. The case report contained erroneous details of the patient's presentation and not all original authors agreed to publish. SP had no involvement whatsoever with this article and was never consulted prior to its publication. BioMed Central apologize to the readers for the error
column17:
and to the authors for any inconvenience caused.

The Publisher and Editor regretfully retract this article [1] because the peer-review process was inappropriately influenced and compromised. As a result
column12: the scientific integrity of the article cannot be guaranteed. A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column13:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1749-799X-9-10.

Journal of Pregnancy has retracted the article titled “Antenatal Steroid Therapy for Fetal Lung Maturation and the Subsequent Risk of Childhood Asthma: A Longitudinal Analysis” [1]. The article was found to contain a substantial amount of material from the following published article by the same authors: D. Pole
column10: “Antenatal steroid therapy for fetal lung maturation: is there an association with childhood asthma?” Journal of Asthma
column14: 2009. That article was cited in the “Methods” section
column15:
but not discussed.

column5: M. Flux Dynamics in Y358 Superconductors. <italic>Materials</italic> 2012
column12:
Switzerland. This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).

It has been brought to our attention by a reader of Materials that substantial portions of this article [1] have been translated from another publication [2] without credit. After confirming this to be the case with the authors
column13: we have determined that indeed this manuscript clearly violates our policy of originality of all material submitted for publication and the generally accepted ethics of scientific publication. Consequently
column14:
the Editorial Team and Publisher have determined that it should be retracted. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Porosity Defect Remodeling and Tensile Analysis of Cast Steel. <italic>Materials</italic> 2016
column8:
Switzerland. This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

We have been made aware that the figures and experimental data of this article [1] are duplicated from another publication by Hardin et al. [2]. In addition
column9:
the first author Linfeng Sun submitted and published the manuscript without the knowledge of the other authors by fabricating contact email addresses.

MDPI is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics and takes the responsibility to enforce strict ethical policies and standards very seriously. To ensure the addition of only high quality scientific works to the field of scholarly publication
column10:
[1] is retracted and shall be marked accordingly. The article is retracted with the agreement of all authors. We apologize to the readership of Materials for any inconvenience caused.

Now it has aroused as a big trouble and
column8:
to solve this problem all the authors have determined that it should be retracted. This decision has been taken purely for bureaucratic aspect. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

The new version is published as [2].

The authors would like to retract the article ""Application of cytology and molecular biology in diagnosing premalignant or malignant oral lesions"" [1]. After publication of the article it came to light that large portions of the article are duplicated from a previously published article [2]. The authors apologize to the readers
column15:
and Editors of Molecular Cancer for the inconvenience caused.

column18:
unless otherwise stated.Retraction

The corresponding author Cory C Toth would like to retract the article [1]. It has come to light that the data obtained at the University of Calgary presented in Figure 4A and Figure 5 have been manipulated which was unrecognized by the corresponding author. The University of Calgary has investigated this case and supports the decision to retract the article. We apologize for misleading the readership of Molecular Pain.

The authors made substantive errors in figure images of this article such that the hypotheses were not tested and the conclusions were not supported.

On this basis
column10:
the Editors formally retract this article from Molecular Vision.

Sincerely

column8:
Switzerland.2015This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

We have become aware that a substantial part of the main text of [1] is copied from multiple other publications. In total
column9: 46% of the main text was taken from publications by the same authors [<xref rid=""B2-nanomaterials-05-00268"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>
column10: <xref rid=""B3-nanomaterials-05-00268"" ref-type=""bibr"">3</xref>] and 10% from other papers [<xref rid=""B4-nanomaterials-05-00268"" ref-type=""bibr"">4</xref>
column11: <xref rid=""B5-nanomaterials-05-00268"" ref-type=""bibr"">5</xref>]. Because of the extent of text taken verbatim from previously published articles
column12:
we have made the decision to retract the article. All the authors of [1] have agreed to this decision. This paper is thus declared retracted and shall be marked accordingly for the scientific record.

MDPI is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE) and takes the responsibility to enforce strict ethical policies and standards very seriously. We aim to ensure the publication only of truly original scientific works. MDPI would like to apologize to the readers of Nanomaterials that this case remained undetected until now. We sincerely appreciate the efforts of anyone who brings matters of plagiarism to our attention in an effort to maintain scientific integrity.

References

column1: <article xmlns:xlink=""http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"" xmlns:mml=""http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"" article-type=""retraction""><?properties open_access?><front><journal-meta><journal-id journal-id-type=""nlm-ta"">Nanomaterials (Basel)</journal-id><journal-id journal-id-type=""iso-abbrev"">Nanomaterials (Basel)</journal-id><journal-id journal-id-type=""publisher-id"">nanomaterials</journal-id><journal-title-group><journal-title>Nanomaterials</journal-title></journal-title-group><issn pub-type=""epub"">2079-4991</issn><publisher><publisher-name>MDPI</publisher-name></publisher></journal-meta><article-meta><article-id pub-id-type=""pmid"">28353626</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""pmc"">5408165</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""doi"">10.3390/nano7040073</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""publisher-id"">nanomaterials-07-00073</article-id><article-categories><subj-group subj-group-type=""heading""><subject>Retraction</subject></subj-group></article-categories><title-group><article-title>Retraction: Khan et al. Structural and Magnetic Response in Bimetallic Core/Shell Magnetic Nanoparticles. <italic>Nanomaterials</italic> 2016
column8:
Switzerland. This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

It has come to our attention that Figure 3 of the title paper [1] contains unacceptable levels of image manipulation and thus does not provide firm evidence of the particles reported. In particular
column9: particles have been copied and pasted to make multiple copies in a single image
column10: and the high contrast between the inner and outer shells of the particles are not plausible given their supposed composition. Further images provided by the authors exhibited the same flaws in contrast. As such
column11:
the conclusions of the paper are no longer supported and the paper will be marked as retracted.

We apologize to readers of Nanomaterials that this issue was not detected earlier and wish to thank the reader who brought this issue to our attention. Nanomaterials is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE) and strives to uphold the highest ethical standards; extensive manipulation of images is not acceptable and we are committed to taking appropriate action when such cases are reported.

ReferenceNairanA.KhanU.IqbalM.KhanM.JavedK.RiazS.NaseemS.HanX.Structural and Magnetic Response in Bimetallic Core/Shell Magnetic NanoparticlesNanomaterials201667210.3390/nano604007228335200" """article-type=.retraction"""

column11:
Switzerland.2016This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

The published paper [1] contains errors that mean that the resulting analysis is incorrect and the conclusions are no longer supported. We have thus decided to retract the original and republish the paper as [2].

The errors are a result of the fortification level standards for rice being incorrectly interpreted as being in mg/kg instead of mg/100 g [3] and therefore the calculation was done with a level ten-fold lower than actually recommended.

We apologize for any inconvenience caused to readers.

Low Iron Diet Increases Susceptibility to Noise-Induced Hearing Loss in Young Rats. <italic>Nutrients</italic> 2016
column8:
Switzerland. This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC BY) license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

The Nutrients Editorial Office has recently been made aware that the figures in the title paper [1] are taken from the same micrographs as those of other papers by the same authors
column9: but purporting to show different species. In particular
column10: Figure 2D of [<xref rid=""B1-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] (rat) is identical to Figure 2D of [<xref rid=""B2-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>] (mouse)
column11: Figure 4B of [<xref rid=""B1-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] (rat) is identical to Figure 4B of [<xref rid=""B3-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">3</xref>]
column12: and Figure 5 of [<xref rid=""B1-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] is identical to Figure 3B of [<xref rid=""B2-nutrients-09-00422"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. Given this
column13: we do not have confidence in the figures and thus the conclusions of the paper. In order to correct the publication record
column14:
the paper [1] will be marked as retracted.

Nutrients is a member of the Committee on Publication Ethics (COPE) and strives to uphold the highest ethical standards; misuse of images is not acceptable and we are committed to taking appropriate action when such cases are reported. We apologize to readers of Nutrients and wish to thank the reader who first reported this case.

column10:
provided the original work is properly cited.Therapeutic effect of prostaglandin E1 in monocrotaline-induced pulmonary arterial hypertension rats

The article [1] has been retracted at the request of the editor and author due to the following reasons: Research Ethics Committee of the Korean Association of Anatomists confirmed (1) the author submitted the false information about the author's affiliation and (2) the author duplicated the Institutional Review Board (IRB) number. The author apologizes to the readers.

column6:
provided the original work is properly cited.Basal cell nevus syndrome showing several histologic types of basal cell carcinoma

On September 30
column10: published a case report by Go JW
column11: et al. on the basal cell nevus syndrome<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>. We accepted the article after having been informed in writing
column13: that it had not been submitted for publication elsewhere. In fact
column15: the same case had already been reported by Moon MS
column17: the colleagues in the same affiliation in Journal of the Korean Society of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgeons in Korean<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref>. We were alerted to this fact by the editorial board of the Korean Society of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgeons. As some of the pictures in the case report in the Annals of Dermatology were utilized without any permission from the original publisher
column18: it is a duplicate publication. Thus
column19:
the editorial board of Annals of Dermatology finally decided to retract it in full.

column9: Vol. 17 of Annals of Indian Academy of Neurology[<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]

column4: and build upon the work non-commercially
column5:
as long as the author is credited and the new creations are licensed under the identical terms.6-0 nylon versus 6-0 vicrylrapide in chieloplasty

It has been brought to the attention of the Editor-in-Chief that the article entitled “6-0 nylon versus 6-0 vicrylrapide in chieloplasty” published in Annals of Maxillofacial Surgery on pages 272-277
column8: [<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] is a duplicate of a paper that has already been published on pages 83-86
column10:
volume 3 as “Comparative analysis of 6-0 nylon and 6-0 vicrylrapide in congenital unilateral cleft lip repair” in Journal of Cleft Lip Palate and Craniofacial Anomalies.[2] Duplicate publication violates the editorial policy of the International Committee of Medical Journal Editors as set forth in the Annals of Maxillofacial Surgery Information for Authors and as codified in the signed statements made by the corresponding author regarding the copyright of their work. This article has been retracted at the request of the Editor-in-Chief and author.

The Editor-in-Chief and the Editorial Board of Annals of Maxillofacial Surgery regrets and apologies for any inconvenience caused by the mentioned publication.

Editor-in-Chief

Annals of Maxillofacial Surgery

I am retracting our article ""Sensitivity of Pyramidal Signs in Patients with Cervical Spondylotic Myelopathy"" [1]
column10:
because it was noted that several expressions of this article were identical to those of previously published paper without the proper citation ""Eur Spine J 2010;19:1684-9"" [2]. I deeply regret this plagiarism. I would like to express my most sincere apology to Prof. Chikuda and the European Spine Journal and to the Editor and readers of Asian Spine Journal.

column4: and build upon the work non-commercially
column5:
as long as the author is credited and the new creations are licensed under the identical terms.Topical vasodilator response in skeletonized internal mammary artery: Is there really a difference?

The Editor and Publisher of the journal Avicenna Journal of Medicine regret to announce that the article entitled “Topical vasodilator response in skeletonized internal mammary artery: Is there really a difference?” published on pages 23–27
column8: has been retracted on the grounds of plagiarism.[<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>] The article contained a substantial amount of material directly copied from the article that was published in volume 9
column9: issue 4 of the journal Global Journal of Health Science
column10: as “Topical vasodilator response is significantly higher in skeletonized internal mammary artery”.[<xref rid=""ref2"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>] The article was submitted to Avicenna Journal of Medicine on 06-23-2016 and accepted on 10-25-2016 after two cycles of revisions. Another manuscript containing a substantial amount of material directly copied from this article was submitted to the Global Journal of Health Science on 04-28-2016 and accepted on 08-31-2016
column11: and published online on 09/28/2016. Avicenna Journal of Medicine published this article in good faith
column12:
and on the basis of signed statements made by the corresponding author regarding the originality of their work and that it has not been published or being considered for publication elsewhere.

Avicenna J Med Biotech 2013; 5(2): 125-132

The author has requested that the original article entitled “Genotyping Analysis of Circulating Fetal Cells Reveals High Frequency of Vanishing Twin Following Transfer of Multiple Embryos” that was published in the April-June 2013 issue of Avicenna Journal of Medical Biotechnology (AJMB) be withdrawn because the results were published without the co-workers being aware of this publication. Therefore this paper is retracted
column5:
considering the fact that it is contrary to the scientific rules and unrespectful of the contribution of the other authors.

Bosani M
column6:
Porro GB. Biologics: Targets and Therapy. 2009;3:77–97.

This paper has been retracted after we were made aware that it contains a large amount of reused
column7:
and uncited material that was not placed within quotation marks.

The following statement has been supplied by Dr Sandro Ardizzone:

The review entitled “Biologic targeting in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease” has been commissioned by this journal and published in 2009 (Matteo Bosani
column9: Gabriele Bianchi Porro. <italic>Biologics: Targets & Therapy</italic> 2009;3:77–97). The paper was written by our young coworker (Dr M Bosani). He has consulted many papers
column10: including our previous reviews published years before. The not perfect knowledge of English language has greatly influenced the writing of the paper itself. So he saved in word file several parts of our previous papers (Ardizzone S
column11: Bianchi Porro G. Inflammatory bowel disease: new insights into pathogenesis and treatment. <italic>J Intern Med</italic> 2002;252:475–496 – Ardizzone S
column12: Bianchi Porro G. Biologic therapy for inflammatory bowel disease. <italic>Drugs</italic> 2005:2253–2286)
column13: and then transferred to the final paper. He was unaware as we are
column14:
of the fact that he could not reuse previously published material in other journals. The reuse of this material was made in good faith.

Taking our responsibility for what happened
column15: we intend to apologize for this inconvenience to the Editor (Dr Doris Benbrook) and Publisher (Dr Tim Hill). Moreover
column17:
I consider appropriate to retract the paper itself.

column3: from the following published article: “Potential of immunotherapy for hepatocellular carcinoma

accepts full responsibility and apologizes to the journal and the other authors. The rest of the authors are not culpable in this plagiarism and are victims of this action.

BioMed Research International has retracted the article titled “Downregulation of MDR1 Gene by Cepharanthine Hydrochloride Is Related to the Activation of c-Jun/JNK in K562/ADR Cells.” [1]. β-Actin loading controls in the Western Blots were duplicated. The authors provided corrected figures but could not provide the original uncropped blots or laboratory books.

Retraction to: British Journal of Cancer (2005) 92
column4:
942–948; doi:10.1038/sj.bjc.6602376

An Internal Review Committee at UT Southwestern Medical Center found evidence of improper replication of figures in this paper. A subsequent review by Dr Gazdar and his staff has independently confirmed the Committee's findings. In this paper
column6: specifically lanes 4–12 of Figure 1A and C (p 944)
column7:
appear to be identical. The authors have therefore recommended the retraction of the manuscript to the Editor-in-Chief of British Journal of Cancer.

Dr Suzuki
column8:
Dr Gazdar and their co-authors sincerely apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused the readers of the British Journal of Cancer.

Retraction to: British Journal of Cancer (2005) 93
column7:
1029–1037; doi:10.1038/sj.bjc.6602837

An Internal Review Committee at UT Southwestern Medical Center found evidence of improper manipulation and replication of figures in this paper. A subsequent review by Dr Gazdar and his staff has independently confirmed the Committee's findings.

In this paper
column10: appear to be identical to Figures 1A and B published in a subsequent paper (<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""bib1"">Suzuki <italic>et al</italic>
column11:
2007). The authors have therefore recommended the retraction of the manuscript to the Editor-in-Chief of British Journal of Cancer.

Dr Suzuki
column12:
Dr Gazdar and their co-authors sincerely apologise for any inconvenience this may have caused the readers of the British Journal of Cancer.

SEE RETRACTED PUBLICATION: http://breast-cancer-research.com/content/14/2/R37

Retraction

The authors would like to retract their article ""Effects of a pre-visit educational website on information recall and needs fulfilment in breast cancer genetic counselling
column21: a randomized controlled trial"" [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>]. After publication of this paper the co-authors noticed a discrepancy between the analyses as described (intention-to-treat analysis) and the analyses as performed (per-protocol analysis)
column22:
leading to an overestimation of the intervention effects. Therefore the authors have decided to retract this paper in its current form.

AlbadaAvan DulmenSBensingJMAusemsMGEMEffects of a pre-visit educational website on information recall and needs fulfilment in breast cancer genetic counselling

The article titled
column6: “MreBCD associated Cytoskeleton is Required for Proper Segregation of the Chromosomal Terminus during the Division Cycle of <italic>Escherichia Coli</italic>”
column9:
vol. 128 of Chinese Medical Journal[1] is being retracted. It has been brought to the notice that the author Feng Lu used unpublished data of Lawrence Rothfield and his laboratory researcher Dr. Cheng Cui. He was previously working in the same research group.

Therefore
column10: on the grounds of data fabrication
column11:
the article is being retracted.

column5:
as long as the author is credited and the new creations are licensed under the identical terms.The effect of using different rinsing angles on the micro tensile bond strength of the sealant to the etched enamel

The article titled
column6: “The effect of using different rinsing angles on the micro tensile bond strength of the sealant to the etched enamel” published in pages 67-70
column8: Vol.5 of Contemporary Clinical Dentistry<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref> is being retracted. It has been found that the same article by the same authors was published previously in pages 213-216
column10: Vol. 4 of Contemporary Clinical Dentistry[<xref rid=""ref2"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. As technical errors lead to duplicity of publication
column11:
therefore the article in concern is being retracted.

Prof. S. G. Damle

Editor in Chief

Contemporary Clinical Dentistry

The corresponding author has formally requested to retract the above-titled paper
column4: which was published online on 9 January 2009. Table 1 has been duplicated from a prior publication (<italic>Brain</italic> 2008;131:3311–3334). The immunoblot image in Fig. 4<italic>C</italic> has been fabricated
column5: and portions of that image were duplicated from a prior <italic>Diabetes</italic> article (<italic>Diabetes</italic> 2008;57:1002–1017; Fig. 6<italic>A</italic>) without the knowledge of the corresponding author. The immunohistochemical images in Fig. 5 were not from the cohorts of mice indicated
column6:
but were taken from older data not representative of the cohorts studied. The author apologizes to the readers of the journal for any inconvenience these issues may have caused.

The corresponding author wishes to retract the above-listed article. Representative Western blots in Fig. 4K were previously published as independent experiments representing distinct experimental conditions in a 2009 Journal of Clinical Investigation article (Fig. 5D; Berglund et al.
column4: J Clin Invest 2009;119:2412–2422) and a 2010 <italic>American Journal of Physiology</italic>—<italic>Endocrinology and Metabolism</italic> article (Fig. 6<italic>A</italic>; Berglund et al.
column5: Am J Physiol Endocrinol Metab 2010;299:E607–E614). The corresponding author contacted <italic>Diabetes</italic> to voluntarily report this inaccuracy and to request a retraction. He takes full responsibility for the error and apologizes to the journal

The following statement was submitted by Jan Borén of the University of Gothenburg (Gothenburg
column4:
Sweden) on behalf of the coauthors listed below and has been reviewed and approved for publication by the American Diabetes Association’s Panel on Ethical Scientific Programs:

This study represents a major effort from several laboratories and considerable resources over several years. While we remain confident that the majority of the results presented are correct
column5: we are concerned by ambiguities identified in this article in light of the fact that the first author
column7: who left the University of Gothenburg in 2009
column8: has been found guilty of scientific misconduct by the Vice-Chancellor of the University of Gothenburg. Science must be credible. In this context
column9:
we would like to thank “Peer 1” from the PubPeer.com discussion for this article (https://pubpeer.com/publications/20460426) for detecting the ambiguities and bringing them to our attention.

We have no evidence of scientific misconduct in this study
column12: sadly passed away in 2011 and none of the coauthors have continued working in this field
column13: we are unable to repeat the experiments performed in the study to clarify the identified ambiguities. Furthermore
column14: we have been unable to contact Pontus Almer Boström to discuss these ambiguities. Therefore
column15:
the coauthors listed below have decided that the most reasonable course of action is to retract the article.

Linda AnderssonBirgitte VindLiliana HåversenMikael Rutberg
Ylva WickströmErik LarssonPer-Anders JanssonMaria K. Svensson
Richard BrånemarkCharlotte LingHenning Beck-NielsenJan Borén
Kurt Højlund
