column10:
provided the original work is properly cited.Myosin VI contributes to malignant proliferation of human glioma cells

Retraction notice to:

Korean J Physiol Pharmacol 2016;20(2):139-145

http://dx.doi.org/10.4196/kjpp.2016.20.2.139

The Editors of Korean J Physiol Pharmacol have informed that this article may include the results of experiments that were not performed by the authors. This possibility has been described in an article published in Scientometrics (https://doi.org/10.1007/s11192-016-2209-6) [1]. Although the corresponding author
column12: claimed the experiments were performed by their team and the data collected were true and valid
column14: all authors have admitted that they used inaccurate methods (inaccurate use of shRNA sequences) and inappropriate presentations of the article (plagiarism). All authors have agreed that retraction from the literature is the best corrective action to the scientific community
column15: and apologize to the Editors and readership of <italic>Korean J Physiol Pharmacol</italic>. Given that the scientific integrity of this article has been compromised
column16:
the entire article has been retracted at the request of the authors and the Editors. We apologize to all affected parties for the inconveniences caused.

column4:
provided the original work is properly cited.

The following article from The Korean Journal of Thoracic and Cardiovascular Surgery
column5: “Effect of pulsatile versus nonpulsatile blood flow on renal tissue perfusion in extracorporeal circulation [<xref rid=""b1-kjtcv-50-411"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]
column6: ” has been retracted by the Journal Editor-in-chief
column7:
Chang-Young Lim.

This is a duplicate publication of the same research which was published in ASAIO J 2005;51:30–6 as “The effects of pulsatile flow upon renal tissue perfusion during cardiopulmonary bypass: a comparative study of pulsatile and nonpulsatile flow [2].” Authors submitted this article without permission of the Editor of ASAIO J which retains the permission for publishing in another language.

It is a requirement of KJTCVS that same research in another language need a permission from previously submitted Journal Editor.

The article ""Effects of Estrogen Deprivation on the Rabbit Clitoral Cavernosal Fibrosis"" in Korean Journal of Urology [1] (2000;41:885-91) is retracted at the request of authors. The authors published a more complete version of the article in other language. The corresponding author expressed an apology for any inconvenience this may cause to the editorial staff and readers.

column19: regret to withdraw our paper entitled ""Specific nephrotoxicity and cardiotoxicity of BT-Cal®
column22:
which was published in the Laboratory Animal Research 2013; 29(1): 7-11.

The reason why we withdraw the paper is a controversy on the interpretation of the results
column23: because the institution performed the study (Laboratory Animal Research Center
column25: Korea) is not an organization approved for Good Laboratory Practice (GLP)
column26:
and the study was not performed according to the GLP's Standard of Procedures.

Our research group and the manufacturer of the material (BT-Cal®) are planning to perform additional study in a GLP organization. Therefore
column27:
it is expected that we can resubmit a manuscript in the future.

Yun-Bae Kim

D.V.M.

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.Role of fine needle aspiration cytology in evaluating mediastinal masses

The following article is being retracted as there was an authorship dispute. One of the authors complained of being uninformed about submission and publication of the article. The article was primarily a thesis work of this author. Other authors were contacted along with their head of department. They claimed that it was a team work but wished to withdraw their names from the list of authors. An expert committee of three eminent chest physicians was made to help resolve the issue. Committee on publication ethics (COPE) guidelines were also taken into consideration. A new author's list could not be prepared because uninformed author and the thesis guides failed to meet the criteria for authorship. Please see ‘From Editor's Desk’ for details on the issue.

D. K. Pandey
column9:
Z. Jairajpuri. Role of fine needle aspiration cytology in evaluating mediastinal masses. Lung India 2009;26:114-6.

column6:
provided the original work is properly cited.Effect of Diet Education on Blood Pressure Changes and Interdialytic Weight in Hemodialysis Patients Admitted in Hajar Hospital in Shahrekord

Izet Masic

Concerning of un-ethical behaviors of some authors of the papers published in previous issues of the journal “Materia Socio-Medica” Editorial Board and me as Editor-in-Chief decided to retract a paper.

We follow COPE Retraction Guidelines (http://publicationethics.org/files/retraction%20guidelines_0.pdf) and publish a separately citation for retracted article.

The case is:

Jafari F
column9:
Effect of Diet Education on Blood Pressure Changes and Interdialytic Weight in Hemodialysis Patients Admitted in Hajar Hospital in Shahrekord. Mater Sociomed. 2014 Aug; 26(4): 228-230.(RETRACTED).

Changed with the article:

Cukic V

provided the original work is properly cited.Urinary biomarkers of acute kidney injury in patients with liver cirrhosisAssociation Between Autoantibodies Against Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Receptor and Thyroid DiseasesThe Effect of Nasal Packing Removal on Patients Anxiety

Izet Masic

Concerning of un-ethical behaviors of some authors of the papers published in previous issues of the journal “Medical Archives” Editorial Board and me as Editor-in-Chief decided to retract several papers.

We follow COPE Retraction Guidelines (http://publicationethics.org/files/retraction%20guidelines_0.pdf) and publish a separately citation for retracted article.

The first case is:

Ahmed QA
column11:
Heba P. Urinary biomarkers of acute kidney injury in patients with liver cirrhosis. Med Arch. 2014;68(2):132-6. PubMed PMID: 24937940; (RETRACTED)

Changed with the article:

Masic I
column14:
Mulic S. Comparison of the Quality Assessment of the Medical Education by students of Bologna and the Old System of Studying. Med Arch. 2014;68(2):132-6.

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4272501/

The second case is:

Latifi-Popovci
column15:
H. Association Between Autoantibodies Against Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Receptor and Thyroid Diseases Med Arch. 2014; 68(2): 79-81.(RETRACTED) 10.5455/medarh.2014.68.79-81

Changed with the article:

Zvizdic Z
column19:
Zubovic SV. Testicular volume and testicular atrophy index as predictors of functionality of unilaterally cryptorchid testis. Med Arch. 2014;68(2):79-82.

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4272499/

The third case is:

Sahin C
column20:
Aras HI. The Effect of Nasal Packing Removal on Patients Anxiety. Med Arh. 2015 Dec; 69(6): 393-395. (RETRACTED).

Changed with the article:

El-Ardat MA
column26:
Zunic L. Buscopan Application as an Analgesic in Primiparas. Med Arh. 2015 Dec; 69(6): 393-395.

http://www.scopemed.org/?mno=223768z

Retraction Notice:

In the article entitled
column9: “Correlation Between High-Density Lipoprotein and Monocyte Subsets in Patients with Stable Coronary Heart Disease” which was published in <related-article related-article-type=""retracted-article"" id=""d36e88"" vol=""21"" page=""3129"" xmlns:xlink=""http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"" xlink:href=""26474031"" ext-link-type=""pubmed"">Medical Science Monitor 2015; 21: 3129–3135</related-article>
column10: sections in the text have been directly copied from a previously published article
column12: “Small high-density lipoprotein is associated with monocyte subsets in stable coronary artery disease”
column27:
Speidl WS in Atherosclerosis 2014 Dec; 237(2): 589–96.

Thus owing to duplicity of text
column28:
the article is being retracted.

column3:
and Neuropeptide Release in Mouse Chromaffin Cells Is Regulated by Myristoylated Alanine-rich C-Kinase Substrate and Myosin II1542013248125112512013

The authors of “Cortical F-Actin
column5: and Neuropeptide Release in Mouse Chromaffin Cells Is Regulated by Myristoylated Alanine-rich C-Kinase Substrate and Myosin II” (Mol Biol Cell [2009] 20
column6:
3142–3154; doi:10.1091/mbc.E09-03-0197) wish to retract the paper.

The retraction arises from a finding by the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Office of Research Integrity (2013) that author Bryan W. Doreian engaged in research misconduct by falsifying data in the paper

column1:
Mol Biol CellmbcmbcMol. Bio. CellMolecular Biology of the Cell1059-15241939-4586The American Society for Cell Biology201857712828970RetractionRetraction for Old Yellow Enzyme Protects the Actin Cytoskeleton from Oxidative Stress132010215842842

The authors of “Old Yellow Enzyme Protects the Actin Cytoskeleton from Oxidative Stress” (Mol. Biol. Cell [2004] 15
column2:
4522–4531; published online before print as 10.1091/mbc.E04-06-0445) wish to retract their paper. They have provided the following statement:

It is with great regret that we have decided to retract the above article. The major conclusions of the article are incorrect
column3: as we have discovered that an unlinked background mutation is responsible for the phenotype ascribed to the <italic>oye</italic> deletions. We have identified the allele responsible for the actin phenotype
column4: and it is a recessive loss of function mutation in the gene <italic>ASC1</italic>. It is this mutation in <italic>ASC1</italic> that causes the reported excessive actin assembly
column6: and sensitivity to oxidative stress. Furthermore
column7: neither the cysteine 285 or cysteine 374 to alanine mutations in actin suppress the actin defects caused by the <italic>asc1</italic> allele. The corresponding author
column9:
takes complete responsibility for this error and greatly regrets any inconvenience his error has caused to his colleagues in the field.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column1: 0	"<!DOCTYPE article PUBLIC ""-//NLM//DTD JATS (Z39.96) Journal Archiving and Interchange DTD v1.0 20120330//EN"" ""JATS-archivearticle1.dtd"">

Mol Biol CellMol. Biol. CellmolbiolcellmbcMol. Bio. CellMolecular Biology of the Cell1059-15241939-4586The American Society for Cell Biology274737594966991E07-10-1055RetractionRetraction for Lectin-deficient Calreticulin Retains Full Functionality as a Chaperone for Class I Histocompatibility Molecules018201627152517251720162413–2423

The authors of “Lectin-deficient Calreticulin Retains Full Functionality as a Chaperone for Class I Histocompatibility Molecules” (Mol. Biol. Cell [2008] 19
column2:
2413–2423; originally published in MBoC In Press as 10.1091/mbc.E07-10-1055) wish to retract their paper. They have provided the following statement:

Our paper reported that two lectin-deficient mutants of calreticulin retained full ability to support the biogenesis of class I histocompatibility molecules and also bound to the same spectrum of newly synthesized glycoproteins as the wild-type chaperone. During recent efforts to extend this work
column3: we were unable to replicate the results. An investigation detected evidence of contaminating wild-type calreticulin in the original mutant cell lines
column4: contamination that occurred by unknown means in the senior author's laboratory. Consequently
column5:
we wish to retract the paper. We continue to work on the nature of the interactions of calreticulin with client glycoproteins and will be publishing thoroughly validated results on this issue in the near future. We offer our most sincere apologies to the scientific community for any difficulties that may have been experienced. All of the authors have agreed to this retraction.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column14:
provided this notice is preserved along with the article's original URL.

The data published in this article [1] and in a preceding article in Molecular Cancer [2] were generated by myself
column16: with collaborators in Germany. The data were originally part of a manuscript on which my collaborators were authors and which remains unpublished. When publishing the data in Molecular Cancer
column17: I failed to obtain the agreement from my past collaborators or to acknowledge their contributions
column18: resulting in an unfair representation of their ideas and thoughts. In light of this
column19:
I have decided to retract the two papers. I deeply apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

The data published in this article [1] and in a subsequent article in Molecular Cancer [2] were generated by myself
column23: with collaborators in Germany. The data were originally part of a manuscript on which my collaborators were authors and which remains unpublished. When publishing the data in Molecular Cancer
column24: I failed to obtain the agreement from my past collaborators or to acknowledge their contributions
column25: resulting in an unfair representation of their ideas and thoughts. In light of this
column26:
I have decided to retract the two papers. I deeply apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

SEE RETRACTED PUBLICATION:

The corresponding author submitted this article [1] to Molecular Cancer on an assumption that the manuscript had been lost during its previous transmission to Cancer Biology and Therapy. In fact it had been received by that journal and was published there
column23:
simultaneously [2]. The authors are therefore retracting the version published in this journal based on the fact that it was initially submitted to the other journal first. The author is deeply sorry for any inconvenience this may have caused to the editorial staff and readers.

Mol Med Rep 13:5068–5076
column5:
2016; DOI: 10.3892/mmr.2016.5195

Following the publication of this article
column6: an investigation conducted internally within our Department has revealed that the data published in Fig. 5a are not reproducible. Consequently
column7: confidence in the conclusions drawn from the reported resultsin the paper has been undermined and
column9:
all authors involved have unanimously agreed to the retraction of this article.

All authors recognize the seriousness of this issue and apologize unreservedly to the editors
column10: reviewers and readers. We are also in the process of examining other studies in the paper. We sincerely regret that this study has been compromised
column11:
and are committed to rapidly correcting the public record and implementing practices to prevent any recurrence of such a situation in the future.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column3:
pathological and genetic characteristics of autosomal dominant inherited dynamin 2 centronuclear myopathy

XINHONG LIU
column6:
TAO WANG and CHUANZHU YAN

Mol Med Rep 13: 4273–4278
column7:
2016; DOI: 10.3892/mmr.2016.5047

We wish to retract our article entitled 'Clinical
column8: pathological and genetic characteristics of autosomal dominant inherited dynamin 2 centronuclear myopathy' published in Molecular Medicine Reports 13: 4273-4278
column9: 2016. The article was submitted by the first author
column11: without the prior knowledge of the corresponding author
column13: or the other authors included on the paper. Furthermore
column14: the details of the paper were not discussed by the authors prior to the submission
column15: and all are in agreement that the paper contains data therein (and interpretations thereof) which are either inaccurate or inappropriate. All the authors agree to this retraction
column16:
and we apologize for the inconvenience caused in this regard.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column5:
2016; DOI: 10.3892/mmr.2016.5954

We would like to retract our article entitled ‘Regulatory T cells exhibit neuroprotective effect in a mouse model of traumatic brain injury’ published in Molecular Medicine Reports 14: 5556-5566
column7:
we recognize that there was an undeclared conflict of interest on the part of certain of the authors. All the authors agree to this retraction. We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience that might result from the retraction of this article.

column5:
2016; DOI: 10.3892/mmr.2016.5294

Following the publication of this article
column6: we regret to report that we have been unable to reproduce the results presented in the paper in our subsequent studies. At the present time
column7: we have not been able to ascertain the reason behind this. Therefore
column8:
we would like to retract this article from publication. All the named authors agree to this retraction. We regret any inconvenience to the readers that this retraction will cause.

column7: LLC 2011</copyright-statement></permissions><related-article related-article-type=""retracted-article"" id=""d30e81"" ext-link-type=""doi"" xlink:href=""10.1007/s11031-011-9216-y""/><custom-meta-group><custom-meta><meta-name>issue-copyright-statement</meta-name><meta-value>© Springer Science+Business Media
column8:
LLC 2012Retraction to: Motiv Emot (2011) 35:165–180 DOI 10.1007/s11031-011-9216-y

The article “Happiness as alchemy: Positive mood leads to self-serving responses to social comparisons” by Camille S. Johnson and Diederik A. Stapel has been retracted from publication at the request of the first author.

We at Motivation and Emotion were informed of the need to retract the article from the scientific literature on October 13
column9: 2011. Our decision to issue this retraction was based on the October 31
column11: report and recommendation from Tilburg University’s Levelt committee
column12:
which found that contributions to the paper by the second author were based on fictitious data or fictitious scientific studies.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1007/s11031-011-9216-y.

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.Platelet-rich plasma in periodontal defect treatment after extraction of impacted mandibular third molars

In the article “Platelet-rich plasma in periodontal defect treatment after extraction of impacted mandibular third molars” which appeared in page 139-34
column7: Jul-Dec 2012 issue of National Journal of Maxillofacial Surgery[<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]
column8: it has been found that the article contains duplicity of text as well as X-Ray images from a previously published article
column10: entitled “Use of autologous platelet-rich plasma (PRP) in periodontal defect treatment after extraction of impacted mandibular third molars”[<xref rid=""ref2"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>] by author Dr. Sammartino
column11:
in Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery. The author has accepted the mistake and has taken full responsibility of the same. The current article is therefore being retracted.

U. S. Pal

Editor-in-Chief
column12:
National Journal of Maxillofacial Surgery (NJMS)

column6:
The Netherlands 85200920093809797© Springer-Verlag 2009issue-copyright-statement© Springer-Verlag 2009

Erratum to: Naunyn-Schmied Arch Pharmacol (2008) 378:203–215

DOI 10.1007/s00210-008-0302-y

It has come to the attention of the journal
column7:
that a review article published last year (Postma et al. 2008) contains several passages which are identical to text published by other authors (Giembycz et al. 2008) without giving reference to the original source of these text blocks. The journal has come to the conclusion that this constitutes plagiarism and hence has decided to retract the paper.

The online version of the original article can be found at http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s00210-008-0302-y.

ReferencesGiembyczMAKaurMLeighRNewtonRA holy grail of asthma management: toward understanding how long-acting β2-adrenoceptor agonists enhance the clinical efficacy of inhaled corticosteroidsBr J Pharmacol20081531090110410.1038/sj.bjp.070762718071293PostmaDSKerstjensHAMten HackenNHTInhaled corticosteroids and long-acting beta-agonists in adult asthma: a winning combination in all?Naunyn-Schmiedeberg’s Arch Pharmacol200837820321510.1007/s00210-008-0302-y18500509" """article-type=.retraction"""

column4: and build upon the work non-commercially
column5:
as long as the author is credited and the new creations are licensed under the identical terms.What makes a Journal Great

The article entitled
column9: vol. 52 of Nigerian Medical Journal<xref rid=""ref1"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref> is being retracted. It has been found that the text used in the article bears close resemblance with a previously published article entitled
column10:
“What Makes a Good Journal Great?”2 by Nancy Girard in AORN Journal (Association of Perioperative Registered Nurses). The Editor-in-Chief of Nigerian Medical Journal has taken full responsibility for the mistake and conveys his sincere apologies to the readership.

Professor Francis A. Uba

Editor-in-Chief

Retraction Note: Nuclear Medicine and Molecular Imaging
column10:
pp 102–109

DOI 10.1007/s13139-010-0027-y

The senior author (J. Lee) and the first author (S. Y. Jeong) have retracted this review article due to misconduct. They have discovered multiple instances of misreferencing and misquotation in the text which raise the concern of potential plagiarism.

The online version of the original article can be found under 10.1007/s13139-010-0027-y.

" """article-type=.retraction"""

column5:

Nucleic Acids Res. (2003) 31
column6:
981–987.

Re-examination of this experiment by a third party indicated that the level of expression of Dicer was not as high as expected. The Dicer gene was cloned between Kpn I and Not I sites and the original description in the paper that it was cloned into the EcoRV site was a description error because the EcoRV site exists within the Dicer gene and thus this EcoRV site was unsuitable to be used for cloning the Dicer gene. Recently
column7: we discovered that the first author of the paper failed to maintain a proper data notebook to support his contribution to this paper. As such this constitutes non-adherence to the ethical standards in scientific research
column8: and in accordance to the recommendations from the National Institute of Advanced Industrial Science & Technology (AIST)
column9:
we respectfully retract this paper.

E. Suyama

M. Iyo

K. Taira

NB. The first author has declined to associate himself with this retraction as he maintains that all the data contained therein are valid.

column16:
provided the original author and source are credited.cover-dateNovember/December 2013RETRACTION

Volume 2
column24: claimed that the <italic>Bacillus anthracis</italic> exosporium proteins BclA and BxpB were cross-linked via isopeptide bonds between the amino-terminal residue of BclA and the side chain of any one of several acidic residues in BxpB. Direct evidence for these isopeptide bonds was provided by the identification of cross-linked peptides derived from proteolytically digested physiological complexes of BclA (or a BclA fusion protein) and BxpB. In these experiments
column25: peptide sequences and positions of cross-links were determined by liquid chromatography-tandem mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS) analysis. The authors recently reexamined the mass spectra used in these analyses and discovered that they were incorrectly interpreted and do not provide evidence for cross-linked peptides or isopeptide bond formation. The misinterpreted data are included in Figure 1 and Tables 1 to 3
column26: and a model based on these data is shown in Figure 5. Furthermore
column27: the analysis of the data in Figure 3 reported to show covalent complexes formed between BclA and variants of BxpB is possibly wrong. This analysis depends on control experiments in which LC-MS/MS was used to identify proteolytic peptides of mutant BxpB proteins. Again
column28: the mass spectra used to identify these peptides were interpreted incorrectly
column29: making a reliable analysis of the data impossible. Due to the misinterpreted data described above
column30:
the authors request that the mBio paper be retracted and offer sincere apologies to others in the field for any confusion caused by publication of this paper.

The authors also request correction of the statement in Acknowledgments in which personnel in the UAB Mass Spectrometry Core Facility are acknowledged for performing LC-MS/MS analyses. When Charles L. Turnbough
column34: it was his understanding (and that of Mei Li) that experts in the core facility had actively participated in the interpretation of mass spectra and had concurred with all peptide identifications. However
column36: the involvement of the core facility was effectively limited to data acquisition
column37: and Li Tan analyzed the mass spectra without assistance. When this situation was discovered
column38: unfortunately well after the paper was published
column39:
all relevant mass spectra were reanalyzed with expert assistance.

Finally
column40: some of the data in the paper are correct and important and can continue to be referenced. These data include the results shown in Figures 2 and 4. Figure 2 shows the formation of extremely stable complexes between BxpB and a BclA N-terminal domain-enhanced green fluorescent protein (NTD::eGFP) fusion
column41: with from one to three copies of the fusion protein attached to a single molecule of BxpB. Figure 4 shows the in vitro formation of stable complexes between purified recombinant BclA and BxpB
column42:
an experiment that has been repeated many times. The nature of the stable BclA-BxpB interaction remains to be determined.

column6:
provided the original author and source are properly credited.An African Ancestry-Specific Allele of CTLA4 Confers Protection against Rheumatoid Arthritis in African Americans

In June 2009
column9: pointed out to us that he and his colleagues reviewed this article and were concerned that our finding may reflect an artifact in the minor allele (G) frequency of the rs231778 SNP in our control group. Dr. Plenge graciously agreed to genotype this SNP and other SNPs in the CTLA4 gene in our African-American patients and controls using a Sequenom iPlex Pool assay. In addition
column10: we repeated the genotyping of the rs231778 SNP in a subset of the African-American controls reported in our study using the same platform as previously reported (Applied Biosystems TaqMan Allelic Discrimination Assays on an ABI 7900HT Genetic Analyzer) with new reagents. In these repeat experiments
column11: we found no difference in the minor allele frequency of the rs231778 SNP between African-American patients (0.060) and controls (0.065) (p=0.607)
column12:
validating the concern that our finding represented an artifact in genotyping.

The major conclusion of our paper
column13: that an African ancestry-specific allele of the CTLA4 gene confers protection against RA in African Americans
column15:
and the paper must be retracted. The decision to retract this paper was reached in consultation with the journal's editors and the purpose of the retraction is to correct the literature.

We wish to acknowledge Dr. Plenge's collegiality and his generosity as he performed the Sequenom genotyping at his expense. Based on the collaboration that grew out of his identification of our error
column16:
we are currently preparing a new article describing the role of the CTLA4 gene and other candidate genes in African-Americans with RA.

No competing interests declared.

column6:
provided the original author and source are credited.Inhibition of Rho-Kinase by Fasudil Suppresses Formation and Progression of Experimental Abdominal Aortic Aneurysms

The authors retract this publication due to technical errors in the experiments reported.

During the process of summarizing data for another manuscript
column7: the authors noticed that some of the data relate to experiments different from those described in the article. The samples for real-time PCR analysis and the aortic diameter measurements originate from the suprarenal aorta
column9:
which is the correct location for measurements in the porcine pancreatic elastase model.

Figure 1
column10: Figure 2 and Figure 4 in the article are affected by the identified technical errors
column12:
there is insufficient evidence to support the main conclusion in this paper. The authors therefore retract this publication. The authors deeply regret this circumstance and apologize to the community.

ReferencePengC

column6:
provided the original author and source are credited.GREB1 Functions as a Growth Promoter and Is Modulated by IL6/STAT3 in Breast Cancer

Following the publication of this article
column7:
Dr. Marc Lippman from the University of Miami Miller School of Medicine raised concerns that the article was based on work completed in his laboratory and which had been employed by the authors without his knowledge or permission.

Dr. Lippman's concerns were evaluated by a review panel at Morehouse School of Medicine which concluded that there was substantial evidence in support of Dr. Lippman's claims and advised that the publication should be retracted. The concerns have also been raised to the attention of the University of Miami which advised proceeding as recommended by Morehouse School of Medicine.

In the light of the recommendation of Morehouse School of Medicine
column8:
the editors retract this publication.

We also wish to make readers aware that references 16 and 21 in the original paper were cited with incorrect author details. The two references relate to the same article and the correct full citation is as below:

Correlation of GREB1 mRNA with protein expression in breast cancer: validation of a novel GREB1 monoclonal antibody. Breast Cancer Res Treat. 2010 Jul;122(2):371-80. doi: 10.1007/s10549-009-0584-x. Hnatyszyn HJ

provided the original author and source are credited.The Effect of Soluble RAGE on Inhibition of Angiotensin II-Mediated Atherosclerosis in Apolipoprotein E Deficient Mice

The authors retract this publication due to concerns about several of the results reported in the article.

After the publication of the article
column7: the authors identified an error in Figure 3A
column8: where the representative oil red stain of the aortic sinus from angiotensin II(-) sRAGE(-) had been duplicated in the angiotensin II(+)
column9: sRAGE 2ug image. Upon a review of the data from the article
column10: the authors also identified concerns in relation to possible duplication of data in Figure 5A (RAGE and MCP-1 panels) and Figure 6A (MCP-1 and TNF-α panels). The authors have indicated that the raw data for Figures 3
column11:
5 and 6 are not available to allow for a full evaluation of the concerns noted.

In the light of the concerns about the integrity of the results and the lack of the raw data relevant to the figures affected
column12:
the authors and the editors retract this publication.

ReferenceLeeD

<article xmlns:xlink=""http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"" xmlns:mml=""http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"" article-type=""retraction""><?properties open_access?><front><journal-meta><journal-id journal-id-type=""nlm-ta"">PLoS One</journal-id><journal-id journal-id-type=""iso-abbrev"">PLoS ONE</journal-id><journal-id journal-id-type=""publisher-id"">plos</journal-id><journal-id journal-id-type=""pmc"">plosone</journal-id><journal-title-group><journal-title>PLoS ONE</journal-title></journal-title-group><issn pub-type=""epub"">1932-6203</issn><publisher><publisher-name>Public Library of Science</publisher-name><publisher-loc>San Francisco
column2: USA</publisher-loc></publisher></journal-meta><article-meta><article-id pub-id-type=""pmid"">25226277</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""pmc"">4167247</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""publisher-id"">PONE-D-14-39497</article-id><article-id pub-id-type=""doi"">10.1371/journal.pone.0108566</article-id><article-categories><subj-group subj-group-type=""heading""><subject>Retraction</subject></subj-group></article-categories><title-group><article-title>Retraction: Pimecrolimus Cream 1% in the Management of Atopic Dermatitis in Pediatric Patients: A Meta-Analysis</article-title></title-group><contrib-group><contrib contrib-type=""author""><collab>The <italic>PLOS ONE</italic> Editors</collab></contrib></contrib-group><pub-date pub-type=""collection""><year>2014</year></pub-date><pub-date pub-type=""epub""><day>16</day><month>9</month><year>2014</year></pub-date><volume>9</volume><issue>9</issue><elocation-id>e108566</elocation-id><permissions><copyright-year>2014</copyright-year><copyright-holder>The PLOS ONE Editors</copyright-holder><license><license-p>This is an open-access article distributed under the terms of the <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/"">Creative Commons Attribution License</ext-link>
column6:
provided the original author and source are credited.Pimecrolimus Cream 1% in the Management of Atopic Dermatitis in Pediatric Patients: A Meta-Analysis

After the publication of the article
column7:
a group of readers raised concerns about several aspects of the methodology for the meta-analysis and the interpretation of the results (http://www.plosone.org/article/comments/info%3Adoi%2F10.1371%2Fjournal.pone.0093095).

Upon follow-up with the authors and consultation with editorial board members
column8:
the following concerns have been identified:

* The interpretation of the reduction in Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) score is incorrect (Figure 2)
column9:
a greater reduction in IGA scores indicates a positive event and thus the analysis shows a beneficial effect of the intervention pimecrolimus.

* Figure 3 is incorrectly labelled
column11:
the interpretation of the results does not take into consideration the direction of the outcome.

* There are concerns about the heterogeneity of the studies analysed in Figure 4
column12: which suggests that the results of the trials should not be combined. The interpretation of the results of Figure 4 is incorrect
column13:
lack of flare constitutes a positive outcome.

* There are concerns about the combination of trials that involved placebo controls with those including active comparators
column14:
particularly in relation to analyses regarding the assessment of adverse events.

* The meta-analysis combined randomized and non-randomized trials
column15:
the analyses were not stratified by study design.

* There are concerns about the use of blinding as a selection criteria for inclusion in the meta-analysis.

* Some aspects of the reporting do not adhere to the requirements outlined in the PRISMA guidelines and about the reproducibility of the search strategy reported.

The editors consider that the concerns above compromise the validity of the conclusions drawn in relation to the efficacy and safety of pimecrolimus cream 1% for the treatment of atopic dermatitis in paediatric patients and as a result retract this publication.

ReferenceHuangC

column7: which was published in final edited form because of ethical misconduct as one of the authors copied some portion from an article published in Turkish language which was detected later. The authors have been notified and agree with the retraction. Retracted on April 15
column13:

column5:
provided the original work is properly cited.Pathological changes in the maxillary sinus mucosae of patients with recurrent odontogenic maxillary sinusitis

Pathological changes in the maxillary sinus mucosae of patients with recurrent odontogenic maxillary sinusitis.

This article titled “Pathological changes in the maxillary sinus mucosae of patients with recurrent odontogenic maxillary sinusitis1” published in Pak J Med Sci. 2014;30(5):972-975. is being retracted. After publication it was found to be plagiarized from an article titled “Structural and functional changes in the mucosa of the maxillary sinus with recurrent odontogenic sinusitis” published in a Russian Journal “The Institute of Dentistry”. 2011 Number 4.2 Thus on grounds of plagiarism the concerned article is being retracted.

Shaukat Ali Jawaid

Chief Editor

Pakistan Journal of Medical Sciences

Karachi - Pakistan.

REFERENCESFengLLiHLing-LingELiCJDingYPathological changes in the maxillary sinus mucosae of patients with recurrent odontogenic maxillary sinusitisPak J Med Sci2014305972975doi: http://dx.doi.org/10.12669/pjms.305.531225225509“Structural and functional changes in the mucosa of the maxillary sinus with recurrent odontogenic sinusitis” was in the Russian magazine “The Institute of Dentistry“. 2011 number 4" """article-type=.retraction"""

column17: la rétraction du manuscrit Aspergillose broncho-pulmonaire allergique lors d'un asthme réfractaire: à propos d'un cas clinique (doi:0.11604/pamj.2015.20.350.6572) par Khalid Lahmadi
column20: Boughrine Nawal et Er-Rami Mohammed du Laboratoire de Parasitologie
column21: Hôpital Militaire Moulay Ismail de Meknès
column23: Maroc [<xref rid=""CIT0001"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]. Au terme de notre investigation
column24: il apparait de manière indiscutable que le manuscrit soumis par Khalid Lahmadi et al. et publié dans PAMJ le 10 Avril 2015
column25: a été purement et simplement plagié par les auteurs. En effet
column26: le manuscrit soumis par Khalid Lahmadi
column29: Boughrine Nawal et Er-Rami Mohammed du Laboratoire de Parasitologie
column30: Hôpital Militaire Moulay Ismail de Meknès
column32: Maroc et publié dans PAMJ est une copie conforme du manuscrit Aspergillose broncho-pulmonaire allergique: un diagnostic à évoquer lors d'un asthme réfractaire 24(2)- e82; doi:10.1016/j.mycmed.2014.01.089) par I. Tlamçani
column35: et M. Er-Rami publiée dans le Journal de Mycologie Médicale [<xref rid=""CIT0002"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. Par conséquent
column36:
nous retirons cet article de la littérature médicale en conformité avec les lignes directrices et les meilleures pratiques éditoriales du ""Committee on Publication Ethics"". Nous nous excusons auprès de notre public pour cette situation malheureuse.

RéférencesKhalidLahmadiHind ElYoussiJawadRochdiBoughrineNawalEr-RamiMohammedAspergillose broncho-pulmonaire allergique lors d'un asthme réfractaire: à propos d'un cas cliniqueThe Pan African Medical Journal.20152035026175839TlamçaniIBenjellounSDehamHEr-RamiMAspergillose bronchopulmonaire allergique: un diagnostic à évoquer lors d'un asthme réfractaireJournal de Mycologie Médicale.20146242e82" """article-type=.retraction"""

This retracts article Emphysematous cystitis and emphysematous pyelitis: a clinically misleading association. Mustapha Ahsaini
column15:
My Hassan Farih. The Pan African Medical Journal. 2013;16:18. (doi:10.11604/pamj.2013.16.18.2505).

PlagiarismRetractionPAMJRetraction

We hereby inform to our readership of the retraction of the article Emphysematous cystitis and emphysematous pyelitis: a clinically misleading association(doi:10.11604/pamj.2013.16.18.2505) by Mustapha Ahsaini
column21: Mohammed Jamal El Fassi and My Hassan Farih</italic> of the Department of Urology
column25: Morocco [<xref rid=""CIT0001"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]. From our investigation
column26: it clearly appears that the majority of the contents of the article by Mustapha Ahsaini and al. published in PAMJ in September 17
column27: 2013 was plagiarized from the article Emphysematous cystitis of the diabetic patient. 2009 Aug; 1(3): 114-116. PMCID: PMC3364639 by Affes Nejmeddine
column32: published in North American Journal of Medical sciences [<xref rid=""CIT0002"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. Therefore
column33:
we withdraw this article of the medical literature in accordance with the guidelines and best editorial practices of the Committee on Publication Ethics. We apologize to our audience for this unfortunate situation.

This retracts article Dental caries and oral health practices among 12 year old children in Nairobi West and Mathira West Districts
column14:
Perry Smith. The Pan African Medical Journal. 2013;12:42.

Retractionscientific misconductduplicated publicationRetraction

We hereby inform to our readership of the retraction of the article Dental caries and oral health practices among 12 years old children in Nairobi West and Mathira West Districts
column20: it clearly appears that the article was published in the <italic><bold>Journal of the Kenya Dental Association</bold></italic> in January 2011 [<xref rid=""CIT0001"" ref-type=""bibr"">1</xref>]. The article was then submitted to the Pan African Medical Journal on 6 September 2011 [<xref rid=""CIT0002"" ref-type=""bibr"">2</xref>]. Therefore
column21:
we withdraw this article of the medical literature in accordance with the guidelines and best editorial practices of the Committee on Publication Ethics. We apologize to our audience for this unfortunate situation.

column16:
unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2015Retraction Note

This article [1] has been retracted by the Editor. A committee at Soochow University has investigated this case and supports the decision to retract the article. Incorrect statistical methods were used to calculate mean and S.D. values and additional errors were made in determining 8-OHdG concentrations. The committee also found that some of the original data were missing. We apologize to the readership of Particle and Fibre Toxicology.

Suxin Gui
column18:
Yuguan Ze and Xiaoyang Zhao contributed equally to this work.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1743-8977-10-4.

column15:
unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2015Retraction Note

This article [1] has been retracted by the Editor. A committee at Soochow University has investigated this case and supports the decision to retract the article. Incorrect statistical methods were used to calculate mean and S.D. values and additional errors were made in determining 8-OHdG concentrations. It has come to light that Figure 1 and Figure 2 were published in a previous article [2]. The committee also found that some of the original data were missing. We apologize to the readership of Particle and Fibre Toxicology.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/s12989-014-0047-3.

ReferencesZhaoXShengLWangLHongJYuXSangXSunQZeYHongFMechanisms of nanosized titanium dioxide-induced testicular oxidative stress and apoptosis in male micePart Fibre Toxicol2014114710.1186/s12989-014-0047-325209749GuiSSangXZhengLZeYZhaoXShengLSunQChengZChengJHuRWangLHongFTangMIntragastric exposure to titanium dioxide nanoparticles induced nephrotoxicity in mice

The authors of this article [1] would like to retract it. It contains duplicated Tax and actin Western blotting images. These misrepresentations do not change the scientific conclusion of the paper. The first author
column37: take full responsibility for the duplication and misrepresentation of the figures in this paper
column38: state that none of the co-authors were involved in or aware of these events
column40:
reviewers and editors of Retrovirology for publishing these duplicated images.

column20: provided the original work is properly cited.<p>The authors would like to retract the article ""The cellular source for APOBEC3G's incorporation into HIV-1""[<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>]. After publication of the article
column21: the authors realized that the electrophoretic images in Figure 4D/E
column22: showing a reproducible result of their previous publication [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref>] (cited as reference 6 [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>])
column23: was mistakenly taken from the same images used in [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B2"">2</xref>]. In addition
column24: Figure 2B is an unintended duplicate image of Figure 1B. This should have been avoided by the authors' careful proofreading of the manuscript. The authors apologize to the readers
column26:
and editors of Retrovirology for publishing these erroneous data.

column16:
unless otherwise stated.Retraction

This poster presentation [1] has been retracted on request of the author Michael W Cho. The Office of Research Integrity at the US DHHS has determined that the first author Dong-Pyou Han committed research misconduct and the poster was prepared based on falsified data [2].

column27:
provided the original work is properly cited.

In our recent Research Article “Individualistic sensitivities and exposure to climate change explain variation in species’ distribution and abundance changes” (1)
column28: we presented an analysis relating species-specific measures of sensitivity and exposure to climate
column29: to species’ recent population changes. While our measure and interpretation of species’ climate sensitivity remain correct
column30: we now recognize our interpretation of the exposure measure was inaccurate: Our climate models included an intercept
column31: representing a nonzero average population growth rate; thus
column32: the exposure measure incorporated not only climate effects but other nonclimatic—and potentially unmeasured climatic—effects as well. While our results still demonstrate that a significant proportion of variation in population trends can be explained by exposure and sensitivity
column33: the correct interpretation of the exposure measure means that the explained variation is not solely due to climate. As such
column34: our conclusion that a large proportion of variation in population changes can be explained by individualistic responses to climate is misleading. Given this
column36: we are wholly retracting the Research Article
column37:
and we apologize that this was not picked up sooner.

column14: provided the original work is properly cited.<p>The Editor-in-Chief and the Medical Editors at BioMed Central have retracted this article [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>] because the first author did not fully declare his association with Koob Scolitech
column15: which holds the rights in and to the Spinealite™ brace and has filed for a patent for that brace. Furthermore
column16:
the direct association between Koob Scolitech and the Spinealite™ brace was not made clear in the article. This undeclared competing interest compromised the peer review process.

Switzerland.2011This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).

It has been brought to our attention by a reader of Sensors that substantial portions of this article [1] have been copied from earlier publications without credit. After confirming this plagiarism with the authors
column17: we have determined that indeed this manuscript clearly violates our policy on originality of all material submitted for publication and the generally accepted ethics of scientific publication. Consequently
column18:
the Editorial Team and Publisher have determined that it should be retracted. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

column15:
Switzerland.2011This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/).

It has been brought to our attention by a reader of Sensors that there existed arguments on both authorship and financial support for this article [1]. After confirming with all authors
column16: we have determined that indeed this manuscript violates the generally accepted policies and ethics of scientific publishing. Consequently
column17:
the Editorial Team and the Publisher have determined that the original paper should be retracted and republished with the authorship and financial support fully disclosed. The paper has been republished as [2]. We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause to our readers.

column9:
Switzerland.2016This article is an open access article distributed under the terms and conditions of the Creative Commons Attribution (CC-BY) license (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).

We have recently discovered that the majority of the text and figures in the title paper [1] is copied from a previously published thesis [2]. We consider this a serious breach of publication ethics and the paper will be marked as retracted.

In addition
column12: had no knowledge of the submission. We have been unable to verify the identity of the third author
column14: and University College Cork do not have a record of a former student or employee of that name. Contact details that the editorial office was provided for the second and third authors are not valid and they are not considered responsible for the preparation
column15:
submission or publication of [1].

We very much regret that this was not discovered during the review process and offer our apologies to readers of Sensors.

column15:
provided the original work is properly credited.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2014Retraction

The original version of this paper (Van Toan and Thi Hanh 2013) is retracted because of ethical concerns: the clinical trial was not approved by an ethical board and the authors did not provide evidence that patient consent was obtained. The scientific advisor for this clinical trial (ANZCTR 2012) at the University of the West of England UK (an affiliation of the corresponding author) indicated he was not aware of this study and that the university was not involved.

It is a requirement that experimental research reported in SpringerPlus was performed with the approval of an appropriate ethics committee
column16:
and that research carried out on humans must be in compliance with the guidelines of the World Medical Association.

Dr. Max Haring
column17:
Executive Editor for SpringerPlus

The online version of the original article can be found at:

column9:
unless otherwise stated.Retraction

The Editor and Publisher regretfully retract the article [1] as there were undeclared competing interests on the part of the author which compromised the peer review process. Furthermore
column10: post-publication peer review raised concerns about the validity of the methods and statistical analysis
column11:
therefore the Editors no longer have confidence in the soundness of the findings. We apologise to all affected parties for the inconvenience caused.

column10: provided the original work is properly cited.<p>The Editor-in-Chief of <italic>Virology Journal </italic>and the authors of this article [<xref ref-type=""bibr"" rid=""B1"">1</xref>] acknowledge that the article does not provide the type of robust supporting data required for a case report and that the observations made are mostly speculative. As such
column11:
the article does not fulfill the criteria for a case report and does not meet the high standards expected of the journal. The authors and the Editor-in-Chief have therefore agreed to retract the article.

The authors have retracted this article [1] as it contains large portions of text and figures that have been duplicated from another article previously published in the International Journal of Clinical Oncology [2]. Lead author Dr Tazi accepts full responsibly for the duplication and would like to apologise to the co-authors
column12:

column15:
unless otherwise stated.issue-copyright-statement© The Author(s) 2015Retraction

The Publisher and Editor regretfully retract this article [1] because the peer-review process was inappropriately influenced and compromised. As a result
column16: the scientific integrity of the article cannot be guaranteed. A systematic and detailed investigation suggests that a third party was involved in supplying fabricated details of potential peer reviewers for a large number of manuscripts submitted to different journals. In accordance with recommendations from <ext-link ext-link-type=""uri"" xlink:href=""http://publicationethics.org/news/cope-statement-inappropriate-manipulation-peer-review-processes#_blank"">COPE</ext-link> we have retracted all affected published articles
column17:
including this one. It was not possible to determine beyond doubt that the authors of this particular article were aware of any third party attempts to manipulate peer review of their manuscript.

The online version of the original article can be found under doi:10.1186/1477-7819-11-311.
